title: vocaloid_boxart_pose
body:
For images where a character is in one of the poses used for the [[Vocaloid]] software's boxart, or the official art for any [[list_of_vocal_synthesizers|vocal synthesizers]].

While commonly used for [[style parody]] and [[crossover]] images since 2007, it began trending on Twitter as a Vocaloid fanart challenge in May 2020.

h4. Examples

* [[Hatsune Miku]]'s boxart pose: post #135361
* [[Hiyama Kiyoteru]]'s boxart pose: post #561377
* [[Kaai Yuki]]'s boxart pose: post #559804
* [[Kagamine Rin]] and [[Kagamine Len]]'s boxart pose: post #171990
* [[Kaito (vocaloid)|]]'s boxart pose: post #8926592

title: kaito_(vocaloid)
body:
KAITO is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed by the YAMAHA Corporation and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the first VOCALOID engine. He was later adopted by Crypton as an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and wears a white [[coat]], brown [[pants]], and a blue [[scarf]]. He is frequently viewed as liking [[ice cream]]s.

He is voiced by the singer Fuuga Naoto. His first appearance was illustrated by [[Kawasaki Takashi]], with the his [[KAITO (Vocaloid3)|second appearance]], for VOCALOID3, being by [[iXima]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8926592: VOCALOID (V1)

title: chimchar
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #390 in the National PokéDex, a Fire type Starter Pokémon.
Chimchar is a bipedal Pokémon resembling a chimpanzee. Its fur is primarily a shade of orange, though its face, outer ears, underbelly, hands, and feet are light yellow. Also a flame on it's butt as a tail

It is one of the "Sinnoh":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Sinnoh starter Pokémon with [[Turtwig]] and [[Piplup]].

It evolves into [[Monferno]].
Japanese Name: [b]Hikozaru[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Torterra]]
Next Pokémon: [[Monferno]]

title: squeans
body:
A symbol next to a character's head to indicate a state of [[sleepy|sleepiness]], [[drunk|drunkenness]] or intoxication. Often has dashes arranged in a circle, or can just be multiple circles. Often includes a curved line.

Not to be confused with [[nose bubble]].

title: tio_klarus
body:
Tio Klarus is one of the main female protagonists from the [[arifureta shokugyou de sekai saikyou|Arifureta]] series.

Tio is the princess of the exiled dragonmen and later becomes one of [[Nagumo Hajime]]'s companions. She becomes a perverted masochist after her first encounter with [[Nagumo Hajime|Hajime]] while being brainwashed by Yukitoshi Shimizu.

title: staring
body:

In Japanese, this is often represented with the "じ～" ([i]jiiii[/i]) onomatopoeia.

* [[tag group:eyes tags]]

body:
When a character partly closes their eyes, either in an attempt to see better, as a reaction to a strong light, or because they are glancing at a object.

title: mihaly_a_shilage
body: The "rival" ace from [[Ace Combat 7]], nicknamed "Mister X." He serves as a test pilot for the Erusean Air Force, with data collected from his flights and engagements serving to help program his country's drone fighters. His full name is Mihaly Dumitru Margareta Corneliu Leopold Blanca Karol Aeon Ignatius Raphael Maria Niketas A. Shilage. He typically flies an [[Su-30]] Flanker, with a dark grey body and bright orange wingtips. [spoilers]In his final duel against [[trigger_(ace_combat)|Trigger]], he would use an [[X-02S Strike Wyvern]] with the same livery.[/spoilers] Also a highly skilled veteran pilot that never lets his victims escape.

title: kei_(ryuu_ga_gotoku)
body: Kei is a Japanese-American hostess that appears in [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 7 Gaiden]], [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 8]] and [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 8 Gaiden]] . She is both modeled and voiced by [[Kson]], a major fan of the Like A Dragon series. Furthermore, she is the only character to share the same voice actor for both the Japanese and English version of the games.

body:

title: elevator
body:
A type of vertical transport equipment that efficiently moves people or goods between floors (levels, decks) of a building, vessel or other structures. Elevators are generally powered by electric motors that either drive traction cables or counterweight systems like a hoist, or pump hydraulic fluid to raise a cylindrical piston like a jack.

h4. See also

* [[Escalator]]
* [[Scissor lift]]

title: kizuna_akari
body:
Kizuna Akari is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] (and [[VOICEROID]]) developed by Vocalomakets and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID4 engine. In 2021, she received updated voicebanks on the [[A.I. VOICE]] engine.

Her appearance was illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]]. She has [[white hair|white]] [[twin braids]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[black jacket]], a [[black dress|black]] [[pinafore dress]], and a [[vertical-striped pantyhose]]. She has [[hair ornament]]s, a single [[bracelet]], and black boots.

title: kuma_(persona_4)
body:
[b]Voiced by:[/b] [[Yamaguchi Kappei]] (Japanese), Dave Wittenberg (English, original release), [[Sam Riegel]] (English, all subsequent appearances)
[b]Persona:[/b]  [[Kintoki-Douji (persona 4)|]], Kamui and [[Kamui-Moshiri (persona)|]] of The Star arcana

The mascot character of [[Persona 4]]. Usually seen as a animal-costume blue bear. In the original Japanese, he is known for adding his name as a verbal tic at the end of his sentences. In the English adaptation, he is known as [b]Teddie[/b] and instead makes a great deal of bear-related puns.

[spoiler]At one point in the game, Kuma gains a human body. Outside his suit, he has blonde hair, blue eyes, and is frequently wearing a frilly white shirt with a rose.[/spoiler]

title: beatrice_castiglioni
body:
[b]Major spoilers below.[/b]

Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]]. Also referred to as "Bīce" (BEE-chee).

[spoiler][[ushiromiya_kinzou|Kinzo Ushiromiya]]'s one and only lover. Her father was an Italian army official, and she accompanied him on a secret mission for the Salo Republic involving the transportation of 10 tons of gold. Traveling by submarine, the crew hit a mine and (with many casualities, including Beatrice's father) were barely able to take refuge on a small Japanese military base on Rokkenjima, where Kinzo was stationed.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]By speaking to each other, Kinzo and Beatrice dearly understood their respective sympathies and fell in love. On Rokkenjima, the Japanese and Italian armies proceeded to slaughter each other over the gold that the Italians transported, with Kinzo and Beatrice being the sole survivors. Beatrice was hurt in the crossfire, and was brought to [[nanjou_terumasa|Terumasa Nanjo]] by Kinzo to be treated. Afterwards, they started a secret relationship on Rokkenjima (due to Kinzo being married already) and eventually produced a child. Beatrice died during childbirth, and Kinzo named the child "[[ushiromiya_beatrice|Beatrice Ushiromiya]]" in her honor.[/spoiler]
other_names: ベアトリーチェ・カスティリオーニ

title: caustics
body:
Patterns of [[light]] projected onto a surface by light rays reflected off or refracted through another object. These can be seen on underwater surfaces, when light passes through materials like [[water]], glass, and the like. The bright ripples you can see on the bottom of a [[pool]] or on things close to it on a sunny day are this.

* !post #4150718

h4. See also

* [[Refraction]]
* [[Ripples]]
* [[reflective_water|Reflective water]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

h4. External links

title: dawn_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Dawn[/b], known as [b]Hikari[/b] (ヒカリ) in Japan, is the female player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon dppt|Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This friendly and upbeat Trainer packs quite a punch, thanks to her travels in Sinnoh. Despite her skill as a Trainer, she can be a little scatterbrained at times [tn](official bio)[/tn].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]]. She wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[poke ball print|print]] [[beanie]], [[hairclip|hairclips]], a [[red scarf]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[bracelet]], a [[poketch|Pokétch]], a [[pink skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], [[pink footwear|pink]] [[boots]], and a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[duffel bag|bag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Platinum Berlitz[/b].

title: helel_ben_sahar_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character. One of [[Bahamut_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|]]'s Speakers.

[spoiler] Created by the Omnipotent as a Speaker, their servant, he was given the name Helel ben Sahar and was tasked with spreading the Omnipotent's words and their will among the people of the realm they created. He chose not to interfere in his master's conflict with ancient humans even after it resulted in the splitting of the Omnipotent into two conflicting and opposed sides; the god of the skies and the god of the stars. The sky god wished to recreate the sky realm while the Astral god opted to leave and create an entirely new world based on the one they had left, neither paying attention to the fate of the Speaker. Still, he continued to await contact from his master so he might continue fulfilling his role as Speaker. For thousands of years he took on the role of observer, watching over the two realms as they changed and evolved, acting only to deal with threats outwith the gods' powers.

Sensing an upcoming calamity that could befall the sky realm and wishing to protect the world his master created and its inhabitants, he decided to join the Singularity, the only known living human with the power to alter course of fate itself, assuming a new name to hide his true identity as a god's servant - Lucio.

In time the predicted calamity was revealed to have been set in motion by [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucilius]], who wished to bring an end to the entire sky realm. Initially Lucio tried to convince Lucilius to abandon his plan and his rebellion against gods, hoping to reach some common understanding as Lucilius was an Astral created in Lucio's image. But negotiations failed and Lucio was forced to feign being defeated by Lucilius, waiting inside the latter's core for the right moment to trap Lucilius in a space between dimensions which would serve as an eternal prison.

After the calamity was halted and the visible threat was dealt with, he started to wonder if he still needed to perform his duties and if his master's wishes could really be good for this world. After all, it was not only the power of Supreme Primarch that saved the world but the combined strength of many different forces. He started to wonder if perhaps the world's current state was already perfect and no longer in need of evolution thanks to living creatures and their ability to support each other and compensate their own weaknesses. He confronted the Singularity with these mixed feelings in a dream. After reaffirming himself in his new stance, he left his role as observer and decided that it was fine to simply continue living on and to use his powers for the well-being of the skies. Aboard the Grandcypher alongside Singularity and their crew, he waits for the day when he can ask his master the true purpose behind himself, the world, and all living beings. [/spoiler]

For his other identity, see [[Lucio (granblue fantasy)|]].
other_names: ヘレル・ベン・サハル

She has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] stylized in [[short twintails]] with [[bangs]], and a [[mole]] [[mole under eye|under her right eye]].

title: argus_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light carrier HMS [i]Argus[/i] (I49). Character designed by [[Nekojira]], voiced by [[Youmiya Hina]].  

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a strapless [[white dress]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], [[thigh strap]] to her right, [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]], [[mini crown]], and a [[necklace]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge to her back, three hull pieces to her left, and a blue [[flight deck]] wrap.

title: thomas_the_tank_engine
body:
A popular British children's show based on [i]The Railway Series[/i] books by Rev. Wilbert Awdry and his son Christopher Awdry, first published in 1945. In the mid-1980s, the series was adapted as a TV Series using model trains, but then animated with CGI starting in 2009 and lasting until 2021.

Became a recurring [[meme]] after its inclusion into [[MLG]] in 2014.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Railway Series":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Railway_Series
* "Wikipedia: Thomas & Friends":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_%26_Friends

title: bartolomeo_colleoni_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian light cruiser [i]Bartolomeo Colleoni[/i]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|grey]]/light [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[double-breasted]] [[red dress]] with a short [[pelvic curtain]], [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]], [[red cape]], and a [[red halo]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of four hull pieces arrayed two per side, with all four of her historical 152 mm twin gun mounts and 533 mm twin [[torpedo tubes]], and uses a [[sword]] as her melee weapon.

title: thermal_paste
body: A thick, viscous substance used to facilitate the transfer of heat between two surfaces by filling in gaps that would otherwise be occupied by air. Usually sold in [[syringe|syringes]]. Used in most PCs and CPU for heat resistance.

body:

title: the_iron_giant
body: A 1999 Western [[Mecha]] Animated Movie directed by Brad Bird and produced by Warner Bros. Animation. Loosely based on the 1968 novel, The Iron Man, by Ted Hughes, the movie is set in the town of Rockwell, Maine during the Cold War. The movie follows [[Hogarth Hughes]], a curious young boy who lives with his single mother, [[Annie Hughes]]. Hogarth soon  discover a giant alien robot from space, the [[Iron Giant (mecha)|]] (voices by [[Vin Diesel]]), and befriend it while helping protect his new friend from the US Military.
other_names: アイアン・ジャイアント

title: paid_reward_available
body:
Indicates that the artist has an alternate version of the post, or materials relating to the post, available as a [[paid reward]]. It may also be used when a [[cropped|free preview]] or variant is uploaded, mentioning that the full unobstructed version or set can be obtained on a subscription platform.

Generally, the artist has the reward linked in the post's [[commentary]].

title: genjitsu_steel_(umamusume)
body:
Anime-only [i][[Umamusume]][/i] character.

Appearing in Season 3, She is a stand-in for [[Real Steel (racehorse)|]], her name even literally means "Real Steel" (Real Steel's name is originally a direct reference to [[Real Steel|the robot boxing movie of the same name]]).

Naturally, being Real Steel in all but name, she is often paired with her RL full sister [[Loves Only You (umamusume)|]] or her RL son (and Real Steel's best progeny by leagues) [[Forever Young (racehorse)|]].
other_names: ゲンジツスチール(ウマ娘)

title: face_stretching
body: When a character grabs another's (facial) cheeks and stretches them apart, drawing the victim's mouth into a wide straight line. Usually done as a gesture of annoyance over something the stretchee has done.

title: starting_future_(umamusume)
body:
[tn]"Generic Competition Uniform"[/tn]

A white [[jacket]] with violet [[kneehighs]], maroon [[shorts]] & [[midriff]]-baring race costume that all [[Umamusume]] horse girl characters (those that already appeared in game) have access to. Often worn by those assuming backup dancer roles in Winning Lives, such as Make Debut. In the game, it serves as a girls' initial racing outfit they have access to if they are [b]2 stars or lower[/b] prior to awakening, wherein they'll switch to their main racing uniform once they've reached [b]3 stars[/b].

Use only the tag if any umamusume characters wearing it, [b]this doesn't apply to their actual racing "competition outfit".[/b]

title: shiranui_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shiranui[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]].

She has [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[aqua eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform ([[white shirt]], [[black vest]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]]), with [[bike shorts]] like her sister Kagerou, [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

She is rather demure and cold. Almost none of her lines have a noticeable tone other than a calm disregard. While she never does anything cruel to her allies and will not reject the player's advances in game, she is indifferent with everything from socializing to marriage.

title: souryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Souryuu[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] dark [[blue hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit, fitting of her name ("[[Seiryuu|Azure Dragon]]"), consists of a [[green kimono]] top with [[wide sleeves]], dark [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], dragon horn-themed [[hairclip]]s for her twintails, flight deck apron, [[white socks]], [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[sandals]], and [[yugake]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[quiver]] with a radio mast to her back, and her real-life [[flight deck]] on her right arm. 

She, along with Hiryuu and [[unryuu (kancolle)|Unryuu]], have been nicknamed the "fluffy dragons" because of their generally soft and womanly appearance, in part to their considerably large breasts, and the fact that the "-ryuu" in their names translate to "Dragon".

title: doodle_sensei_(blue_archive)
body:
A depiction of [[Blue Archive]]'s [[Sensei (blue archive)|]] (the player character), originating from [[Arona (blue archive)|]]'s drawing of the sensei. He is presented as a [[child's drawing]] caricature of a man with sparse hair and a rather distinctive "[[smile]]".

He is frequently used to represent the [[pervert|perverse]] side of the fanbase, and by far the most common depiction of sensei within the Blue Archive community.

Typically, Doodle sensei is depicted literally as a doodle from head to toe. Though he is also often depicted (particularly in NSFW works) as a [[faceless male]] with a piece of [[paper]] depicting the doodle [[paper on head|attached on his face]] as a [[mask]]. In some cases, the entire head will be replaced with the doodle's version instead.

title: sleeveless_dress
body:
A [[dress]] with [[sleeveless|no (attached) sleeves]].

Sleeveless dress can be used together with [[detached sleeves]], since sleeveless dress only refers to the torso garment, and do not take detached sleeves into account.

Do not confuse this tag as a "catch-all" tag for all dresses that simply leave the shoulders [[bare shoulders|bare]].
* If the dress has a [i]low and wide-cut neckline[/i] and has [i]attached[/i] sleeves that sit on the arms instead of on the shoulders, it is an [[off-shoulder dress]].
* If the dress has no attached sleeves and has no support of the shoulders (ie. [[halterneck]]s, shoulder straps, etc.) to keep it in place, it is a [[strapless dress]].

Sleeveless dresses, [[strapless dress]]es, and [[off-shoulder dress]]es are mutually exclusive to each other.

h4. Correct examples
* !post #2221907
* !post #7303941
* !post #3267928

h4. Incorrect examples
Do not tag [[strapless dress]]es as "sleeveless dress".
* !post #8922940
* !post #6409043
* !post #8153590

h4. See also

* [[Spaghetti strap]]
* [[Strapless dress]]

title: forced_perspective
body:
An [[optical illusion]] where an object appears either closer, larger, smaller, or farther away than it actually is.

It manipulates human visual perception through the use of scaled objects and the correlation between them and the vantage point of the spectator or camera.

h4. Examples

* !post #8282783: Classic example of holding up the [[Leaning Tower of Pisa]]

title: ishmael_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.08 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after the narrator of the 19th century novel "Moby-Dick.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby-Dick

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[orange hair]], [[green eyes]], [[freckles]], and wears a [[headband]] made of rope with 2 [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]s. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]], but has a [[torn coat|torn]] [[black coat]] the length of a [[jacket]] instead of the standard [[black coat]]. 

She wields both a [[shield]] and [[flanged mace]] in her base identity with the English word 'Hearse' written on the shield. Her rope headband is consistent across all of her identities, although sometimes wearing it as a [[hairband]] or attaching it to her weapon instead of wearing it.

Sometimes drawn with [[tentacle hair]] due to a certain prerelease artwork (post #7489139).

title: fortnite
body:
A free-to-play third-person shooter developed by Epic Games, notable for spearheading the surge in popularity for battle royale games and featuring collaboration events with other entertainment franchises and real-world music artists. Some of the copyrights that have collaborated with the game include [[Boku no hero academia]], [[Cowboy Bebop]], [[DC Comics]], [[Dragon Ball Super]], [[El Chapulin Colorado (Series)|]], [[Family Guy]], [[Futurama]], [[Jujutsu Kaisen]], [[Invincible (series)|Invincible]], [[Marvel]], [[Star Wars]], [[Naruto Shippuuden]] and [[Rick and Morty]].
 It is currently available for [[PlayStation 4]], [[PlayStation 5]], [[Xbox One]], [[Xbox Series X]], [[Nintendo Switch]], [[computer|PC]], and [[smartphone]]s.

The game has become the subject of many [[meme]]s due to its silly dance emotes, primarily minor playerbase, and the absurdity of its collab events.

title: hololive_idol_uniform_(origin)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] [[idol clothes]] worn by [[hololive]] members for live events and in certain [[promotional art|promotional artworks]] between 2020 and 2023, originally co-designed by [[Amagai Tarou]] and [[Narumi Nanami]]. The uniform first debuted at the 2020 [[Nonstop Story]] live concert, and has since become the standard outfit for the group's idol activities.

Since new members usually don't receive their idol outfit until several months after debut, artists usually come up with their own interpretations that incorporate elements from their default outfits and may differ from the final official depiction.

h4. Original JP version

It consists of a [[sleeveless]] shirt, a [[layered skirt|layered]] [[white skirt]] [[miniskirt]] in a [[skirt set]], a golden [[belt]] with a small [[white bow|white]] [[bow skirt|bow]] on the hip and a [[large bow]] on the [[back bow|back]], [[white gloves]], [[wrist cuffs]] and [[white boots]]. The only exception to this is AZKi's version of the outfit, which is primarily black instead. The accent colors, legwear, and accessories differ to match each talent's color scheme and personality. The top of the outfit comes in 3 variants:
* The first variation, worn by [[Tokino Sora]], [[AZKi (hololive)|]], [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], [[Shirakami Fubuki]], [[Minato Aqua]], [[Nekomata Okayu]], [[Uruha Rushia]], [[Shiranui Flare]], [[Amane Kanata]], [[Omaru Polka]], [[Momosuzu Nene]] and [[Takane lui]] features a [[white vest]] with a [[bowtie]].
* The second variation, worn by [[Roboco-san]], [[Yozora Mel]], [[Aki Rosenthal]], [[Natsuiro Matsuri]], [[Nakiri Ayame]], [[Yuzuki Choco]], [[Oozora Subaru]], [[Shirogane Noel]], [[Houshou Marine]], [[Kiryu Coco]], [[Tsunomaki Watame]], & [[Shishiro Botan]] features a [[halter shirt]] with a [[navel]] [[navel cutout|cutout]] and an [[armlet]].
* The third variation, worn by [[Sakura Miko]], [[Akai Haato]], [[Murasaki Shion]], [[Ookami Mio]], [[Inugami Korone]], [[Usada Pekora]], [[Tokoyami Towa]], [[Himemori Luna]], & [[Yukihana Lamy]] features a [[corset]] or [[bodice]] with [[frills|frilled]] [[frilled straps|straps]].

h4. 2022 holoFes version

A different "version" of the outfit worn by all members was debuted at the 2022 hololive Super Expo, in which the members wear the official event [[t-shirt]] [[tied shirt|tied]] on top, while retaining their respective skirts and legwear from the regular idol outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3731704: Original version
* !post #5231110: 2022 holoFes version

h4. See also

* [[hololive Idol Uniform (Bright)]] - The idol uniform introduced for the 4th Hololive Festival "Our Bright Future"
* [[hololive Idol Uniform (Color Rise)]] - The idol uniform introduced for the 6th Hololive Festival "Color Rise Harmony"
* [[holoMyth Anniversary outfit]] - The idol uniform worn by [[holoMyth]] during their 2nd anniversary
* [[List of hololive official costumes]]

An [[angel]] who's been visiting the mortal world and got into trouble. During that time, their halo broke and prevented them from returning to Heaven and using their angelic powers.

[b]Appearance:[/b] Petite body of androgynous shape, with the appearance of a mid-puberty teen, yet with both sets of "bulges" (chest and crotch). Waist-long [[blonde hair]] with shoulder-long [[sidelocks]]. [[Blue eyes]]. Wears a [[white_dress|white]] [[strapless dress]] that barely covers their [[bike shorts]], and wears [[brown sandals]] on their feet. Has simplistic [[angel_wings|angelic wings]] with a minimum of detail, and a [[halo]] in the shape of a broken torus.

* They are referred to as 亜種 (Ashu), meaning subspecies, in the Japanese fandom and "Fanloid" in the English fandom.
* The list is set up by official engine generation, character, and chronicle release.
* The Derivatives are listed by company acknowledged types first- then followed by a listings for unofficial types.
* See [[List of VOCALOID characters]] for the official characters.

title: yuzuki_yukari
body:
Yuzuki Yukari is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] and [[VOICEROID]] developed by Vocalomakets and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID3 and VOICEROID+ engine on December 22, 2011. She is voiced by [[Ishiguro Chihiro]].

She has light [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[rabbit ears|rabbit eared]] [[hoodie]], [[halter dress]] (with a [[criss-cross halter]]), and [[striped legwear]]. She has [[hair ornament]]s, a single [[bracelet]], and shoes with an [[anklet]] design. Her hairstyle is [[short hair with long locks]] but it often looks like [[low twintails]].

In July 2020, it was announced that Yukari's next voicebank would be on the [[CeVIO]] engine. In 2021, voicebanks with the [[A.I. VOICE]] engine were also announced.

Her appearance is officially illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]].

h4. Appearance

title: kizuna_ai
body:
The world's premier [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. She uploads a variety of videos to her YouTube channel, the A.I. Channel, in a similar format to other popular YouTubers. She's produced by activ8 under their [[Kizuna AI Inc.]] autonomous subsidiary.

Her character designer is [[Morikura En]] (post #2638467), while her [[voice actor]] was kept a secret (until April 24, 2020 when it was revealed that [spoiler]Kasuga Nozomi[/spoiler] was her "voice model"). She made her debut with the video [i]"Creating A Twitter account!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoPFGj3uuYo][/i] on November 29, 2016. Her 3D model is available for "download":[http://kizunaai.com/download-page/] from her official website. 

She describes herself as a 16 year-old super intelligent A.I. that is curious about humans. As the sole resident of an endless white void, she finds human life fascinating, and wishes to use her channel to learn more about them. In a "live stream":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C3Fx-9s9Y68] celebrating a new subscriber milestone, Kizuna Ai gave her impression of her own three-sizes: 83-56-81.

On February 26, 2022, Kizuna Ai went on an indefinite hiatus following a final [i]hello, world[/i] virtual concert. At the final live, an [[kizuna no allele|anime project]] and a [[CeVIO]] voicebank ([[KZN (cevio)|]]) based on her were announced. Exactly 3 years later, on February 26, 2025, she announced "the resumption of her activities":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j53m3DSqhKo.

Kizuna has had an immense amount of game collabs, including an appearance as a shipgirl in [[Azur Lane]], an unlockable [[Fall Guy]] skin in [[Fall Guys]], and an appearance as a playable pilot in [[Super Mecha Champions]]. activ8 has also ensured she had collaborations with crypto ventures, such as Otaku Coin and Japanese metaverse/NFT project METAANI, as well as previously having talked about Bitcoin, which is met with mild controversy among anti-crypto crowds.

title: dragon_king_naga
body:
Dragon King Naga, the female king of the Dragon kingdom, is one of the protagonists of [[senki_survival_saga_-_isekai_no_unmei_wo_kaketa_mujintou_fujun_iseikouyuu|Senki Survival Saga - Isekai no Unmei o Kaketa Mujintou Fujun Iseikouyuu]].

Dragon King Naga possesses shapeshifting magic, able to switch between human and dragon form. In her human form, Naga is a [[dark-skinned_female|dark skinned]] woman with [[dragon_horns|dragon horns]], [[sharp_teeth|sharp teeth]], [[large_breasts|large breasts]], [[scales]] on her arms and legs.

title: anastasia_empirial
body:
Anastasia Empirial, the princess of the Elf kingdom, is one of the protagonists of [[senki_survival_saga_-_isekai_no_unmei_wo_kaketa_mujintou_fujun_iseikouyuu|Senki Survival Saga - Isekai no Unmei o Kaketa Mujintou Fujun Iseikouyuu]].

Anastasia is a [[petite]], [[blonde_hair|blonde haired]] [[elf]]. She wears a [[dress]] with [[detached_sleeves|detached sleeves]].

title: olga_of_kyiv
body:
[b]Olga of Kyiv[/b] was the ruler of the [[Ukraine|Rus']] from 945 to 960 (regent for her son Sviatoslav) and was later named a saint by the Eastern Orthodox Church for her efforts to convert the Rus' to Christianity.

Another deed she is famous for is her revenge on the Drevlians, who had her husband, Igor of Kyiv, killed.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Olga of Kiev":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olga_of_Kiev]

title: mori_calliope_(grimoire)
body:
The 11th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mori Calliope]], debuting for her 2nd solo 3D live GriMoire.

It's a [[tight dress|tight]] [[black dress]] similar to her [[mori calliope (1st costume)|default]], but with a [[miniskirt|shorter skirt]], a [[black corset]], a removable [[brown jacket|dark brown]] [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[fur jacket]], [[black gloves]] and [[black boots|black]] [[high heel boots]] with a [[gold trim]], a [[thigh strap]] on her left leg and a black [[headpiece]] resembling a set of [[horns]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this this costume, she has her [[very long hair|waist-length]] tied into a [[ponytail]] held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]].

body: [[ai-generated|AI]] prompter.

title: zero_(pgr)
body:
Zero is a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], she is a mechanoid associated with the Church of Machina under the title 'Lover'.

Zero takes on the look of a female humanoid with very little biological features, she has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]], left side black and right side white, in a [[two side up]] style. Has [[red eyes]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under each eye]]. Wears thick [[black eyeliner]] and has a large heart shaped decoration on her chest.

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: martin_(pgr)
body:
Martin is a 'Bionic', a sentient war machine developed by the ARU. Martin is a Bionic based on a [[polar bear]], though the anatomy proportions are modified for bipedal movements. During the event of 'Firn Night', Martin together with [[Nanami (pgr)|]] played a key role in securing the victory for the ARU and Babylonia forces.

Though his name is Martin, Nanami addresses him with a wide variety of names such as and not limited to: Matty, Martini, Morley, Morty.

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: tifa_(pgr)
body:
Tifa was a Construct in service to Babylonia's Task Force Suzaku, her team was defeated and her Commandant was killed prior to the story. <spoilers>She was captured and rebuilt by the Ascendant [[Roland (pgr)|]], turned into the enemy boss unit '[[Iron Maiden (pgr)|]]'</spoilers>. Her memory was recovered and recorded, designed to be used exclusively for Vera's [[vera: garnet (pgr)|Garnet]] frame.

A support type Construct, she uses two [[floating weapon|floating]] [[energy gun]]s in combat, her uniform consist of a [[grey dress|grey]] [[collared dress]], [[grey capelet|grey]] and [[red capelet]], [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]], her [[headgear]] has the appearance of a [[spiked headband]].

h4. Official arts

* !post #4622298: Memory slot 1 and 4
* !post #4622301: Memory slot 2 and 5
* !post #4622299: Memory slot 3 and 6

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: signa_(pgr)
body:
An in game item from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], exclusively designed for [[Alisa (pgr)|]] ([[Alisa: echo (pgr)|Echo]] frame).

A girl wearing [[white tank top]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] with [[side slit]]s, seen using a [[zweihander]] with balance scales hanging from the guard. Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[green eyes]].

h5. External Link
* "GrayRavens wiki - Signa":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Signa]

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

A [[masked]] female entity with [[black dress|black]] and [[red dress|red]] [[two-tone dress]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

body:

A girl with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in the style of [[twin braids]], has [[red eyes]] with [[magic circle]] shaped pupils. Battles with [[energy weapon]]s ([[scythe]], [[huge weapon]]).

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

body:
An enemy boss unit from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], Huaxu an AI, it has projected body appearance of a [[ghost]]/[[spirit]] and is constantly [[floating]], has no physical body except for the head, [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], and four [[disembodied hand|disembodied]] hands. Has [[blue eyes]] with [[red eyeliner]] and [[facial mark]] of two streams of tears.

title: villier_(pgr)
body:
Villier  is a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], he is the brother of [[Qu (pgr)|]] and looks almost indistinguishable from his sister apart from the male style attire and a shorter hair length.

He has [[short hair|short]]/[[medium hair|medium]] length [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]] with [[red eyeliner]], has a [[mole under eye|mole under right eye]]. Typically depicted in [[chinese clothes|Chinese style clothings]] similar to [[hanfu]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6899542

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: diana_(pgr)
body:
Diana is a member of the Forest Guards of the Arctic Route Union, a military <spoilers>penal</spoilers> unit made up of advanced quadrupedal Constructs. <spoilers>Since Rosetta's departure for Babylonia, Diana has taking up the leadership role within the Forest Guards.</spoilers>

h5. Appearance
Diana is [[cyborg]] and [[taur]] / [[centauroid]] in appearance and has very little biological features below her head, she has [[aqua eyes]] and [[grey hair]], overall hair length is [[long hair|long]], hair style is similar to [[hime cut]], [[straight hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] with [[blunt ends]].

Possible tags include: [[Antlers]] / [[Fake antlers]], [[Headgear]], [[Chin guard]]. [[Metal collar]], [[Bodysuit]] / [[Impossible bodysuit]] / [[Skin tight]], [[Cloak]], [[Mechabare]], [[Earrings]] , [[Polearm]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: rosetta_(pgr)
body:
An enemy boss and later on a playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], leader of the Forest Guards of the Arctic Route Union, a military <spoilers>penal</spoilers> unit made up of advanced quadrupedal Constructs. Voiced by Sawahiro Miyuki.

Rosetta's only playable appearance in-game is the [[rosetta: rigor (pgr)|Rigor]] frame, almost entirely [[mechabare|mechanical]] and [[cyborg]] in appearance. She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[white hair]] with [[center-flap bangs]] and two [[short twintails]] at the back, has [[yellow eyes]].

As a boss encounter, she is [[taur]]/[[centauroid]] in appearance (see post #6339663), with a large mechanical half body attached to the back of her hips, forming a horse-like body for the centaur appearance.

There exists an [[aged down]] version of Rosetta when she was still human. That depiction also has a similar hairstyle as the Construct appearance, but with [[two side up]] in the hair style instead of the twintails.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25038580: [[Rosetta: Rigor (PGR)|Rigor (Default)]]

title: changyu_(pgr)
body:
Changyu (Pinyin: Cháng Yǚ) is a character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], a Construct in service to the Akdilek Commercial Alliance, born in Kowloong but ended up onboard Asslam after many twists and turns. First introduced during the patch 'Eternal Engine', then introduced as a playable Omniframe during 'Lost Chapter'. Voiced by Hanae Natsuki.

Younger in appearance amongst playable Constructs, Changyu has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[black hair]] in an [[unkempt]] manner, has a [[single braid]] just above the nape and a strand of [[ahoge]]. He has [[red eyes]].

h4. Appearance

title: watanabe_(pgr)
body:
A playable character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. Voiced by Yoshimasa Hosoya.

Leader of the Forsaken, a paramilitary faction surviving on the surface of an apocalyptic Earth. Formerly a Babylonia task force pilot, Watanabe stayed behind due to grievances with the remaining human government and worked to support human survivors in his own way.

h4. Appearance

title: asimov_(pgr)
body:
Asimov is the head of the Science Council of Babylonia as well as holding a chair in the overall Babylonia council, an exceptional genius for his age, but his rationalist thinking makes him a difficult man to get along with.

h4. Appearance

Asimov has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] often times depicted [[messy]] or [[unkempt]], his eye colour is [[red eyes|red]] and usually have [[bags under eyes]].

Asimov's uniform is mostly white in colour, he wears a [[cloak]] or a [[surcoat]] that covers most of his uniform underneath, the outerwear has [[high collar]]s design.

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: celica_(pgr)
body:
Celica is a military officer aboard Babylonia, she assists the player in various capacity both in logistics and combat throughout the story. Serves as the game's tutorial mentor.

h4. Appearance

Celica has [[pink eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied up in [[twin braids|two braids]], a shorter braid in front and a longer braid on her back, both tied with a [[black ribbon]]. Celica's [[military uniform|uniform]] consist of a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]], a black [[open jacket|opened]] [[military jacket]] with shoulder [[military rank insignia|rank insignia]], [[detached collar]] and [[dog tags]] around her neck.

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: alisa_(pgr)
body:
Alisa is a NPC <spoiler>and a boss battle encounter</spoiler> in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], introduced at first as Lena, a temporary member of the Iris Warbler team lead by [[Ayla (pgr)|]], she became a playable character in the 'Everglowing Justice' patch. Voice by [[Anzai Chika]].

Alisa has [[blue eyes|blue]] [[ringed eyes]], [[short eyebrows]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], typically seen together with a robotic companion [[Cecilie (pgr)|]], uses a [[bow (weapon)|]] in combat.

h4. Appearance

title: simon_(pgr)
body:
A NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], Simon is a human Commandant of Babylonia graduated from the Academy at the same time as the [[commandant (pgr)|player character]]. After the event of Firn Night he was assigned to lead the team 'Dark Aries', consist of Captain [[Palma (pgr)|]], [[Lillian (pgr)|]] and [[Noan (pgr)|]].

Simon has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], has [[long bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], he has [[yellow eyes]] and wears a pair of [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]], has a single [[mole under eye|mole under left eye]]. His uniform consist of a [[blue coat|blue]] and [[brown coat]] ([[open coat]]) over a [[blue shirt]]. He is sometimes depicted with [[nausea]] as he suffers from vehicle related motion sickness.

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: lillian_(pgr)
body:
Lillian, a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. She is a Construct and a member of Dark Aries squadron of Babylonia, currently under Commandant [[Simon (pgr)|]].

Lillian takes on the form of a young girl with [[blue eyes]] and [[pink hair]], her hair style is [[two side up]], other style elements are [[crossed bangs]] and [[hair intakes]], wears a [[black hairband]] and her Inver-Device ([[headgear]]) is fitted above her sidelocks on each side. She is otherwise human in appearance, no other mechanical elements.

Her outfit consist of a [[black undershirt]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]], a [[pink necktie]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]] held up by a [[pink belt]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

title: palma_(pgr)
body:
Palma is a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. She is a Construct and the Captain of the Dark Aries squadron of Babylonia, currently under Commandant [[Simon (pgr)|]].

She has [[green eyes]] with [[ringed eyes|rings]], her hair style is [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with lime green coloured [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair|inners]], wears a [[single earring]] on her left ear. Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] and attached on the bicep area, has exposed [[robot joints|hinge joints]] and [[arm blade]]s attached to them.

Her apparels consist of a [[black bodysuit|black]] [[sleeveless bodysuit]] and a [[see-through apron]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Punishing: Gray Raven Characters]]

body:
A non-playable character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

Commandant of Egret, a task force that leads the charge in defeating corrupted enemies with the end goal of reclaiming Earth for humanity. Known for her very egotistical outwards attitude but often associated with the characteristics of a [[tsundere]].

h4. Appearance

title: no._21's_buddy_(pgr)
body:
[[No. 21 (PGR)|]]'s battle companion for her [[No. 21: XXI (PGR)|XXI]] frame. Originally a [[non-humanoid robot|medical co-bot]]. Addressed affectionately as "Buddy" (ちびっ子, Chibiko).

Buddy's colours change depending on the [[official alternate costume|coating]] equipped by the player. The basic four-legged ball-shaped body is retained for all coatings.

[i]Do not tag any floating [[drone]]s as Buddy.[/i] Buddy is only used for the walker robot.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6822721: Reference sheet
* !post #7394262: Buddy accompanying [[No. 21 (PGR)|]]

title: bambinata_(pgr)
body:
A playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], she is <spoiler>the step-sister and</spoiler> a member of the Egret squadron lead by [[Vanessa (pgr)|]]. Voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]]. Her Vitrum frame is originally designed by [[D.K]].

Bambinata is very [[petite]] in appearance, most child like amongst all playable Constructs. She has [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]] with [[blue eyes]], typically depicted as a [[marionette]] [[puppet]] [[dancing]] [[ballet]] ([[ballerina]]) with [[puppet strings]] attached to her.

title: kamui_(pgr)
body:
A playable character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

Member of Strike Hawk, a task force that leads the charge in defeating corrupted enemies with the end goal of reclaiming Earth for humanity. Outgoing and happy-go-lucky, Kamui brings the jokes (and occasional stress) to his team. Shares his construct body with [[Camu (PGR)|]], a [[dark persona]] of unknown origin. [spoilers]Later revealed that Kamui is an alternate persona of Camu born out of the latter's wish before construct surgery to seal his hateful and angry side.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

title: chrome_(pgr)
body:
A playable character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. Voiced by Hirakawa Daisuke.

Leader of Strike Hawk, a task force that leads the charge in defeating corrupted enemies with the end goal of reclaiming Earth for humanity. Formerly known as Langston Smith, Chrome is unique in that he is both a construct and a commandant, the latter of which is a title normally only held by humans.

body:

title: searchlight
body:
An extremely bright outdoor [[spotlight]]. Originally used to search for enemy [[aircraft]] or escaped detainees at night, hence the name. They were later used for decorative purposes.

This tag can also be applied to posts where character are being "caught" by the searchlight outside of performative purposes. For when characters are being highlighted while performing, use [[spotlight]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[crack of light]]

title: yulha_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A Nikke from [[Triangle (nikke)|]] with [[Admi (Nikke)|]] and [[Privaty (Nikke)|]]. An office worker that suffers from work overload. She is the leader of Triangle, and a reliable leader at that. Others inexplicably refer to her as Ghost.

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[sharp teeth]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|grey]]/[[white hair|white]] [[messy hair]]. Wears a [[white coat| white]] [[coat on shoulders]], [[black footwear|black]] [[chaps]], a [[black leotard]] with [[navel cutout]], a [[red jacket|red]] [[cropped jacket]], carries a [[sniper rifle]] [[weapon on back|on her back]], [[black gloves]] and a [[belt]].

h4. Official Art

title: okinami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Okinami[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kitou Akari]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[brown_hair|brown]]/[[black_hair|black]] on the outside, [[pink_hair|pink]] inside), [[green eyes]], and blue-frame [[glasses]]. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

title: aa_shuukatsu_no_megami-sama
body:
English translation: [b]Ah! My Job-Hunting Goddess[/b]

Spin-off manga of [[aa_megami-sama|Aa! Megami-sama]] by Aoki Yuhei and drawn by [[Yoshizuki Kumichi]], with series creator [[Fujishima Kousuke]] serving as a creative consultant. Taking place after the end of the main series, the spinoff chronicles the efforts of [[Belldandy]] in finding a job to help support [[Morisato Keiichi|Keiichi]] during a recession. It premiered in the March 2019 issue of Kodansha Monthly Afternoon magazine and ended in January 2022 for a total of thirty-four chapters spread across five volumes.

title: ramen_ladle
body:
A [[spoon]]/[[ladle]] used to eat [[ramen]], usually made out of wood or plastic. It has a long, straight handle with an almost perpendicular bowl. The bottom of the spoon has a particular design with geometrical cuts instead of a smooth bottom.

Not to be confused with [[Chinese spoon]], another spoon that can be used to eat ramen. A Chinese spoon is much smaller and has a thicker and rounder shape.

* !post #6969066

title: playing_card
body:
A classical set of [[card]] consists 52 unique cards, categorized by suit and by rank. The four suits of the french deck are [[heart|hearts]] (♥), [[spade_(shape)|spades]] (♠), [[club_(shape)|clubs]] (♣), and [[diamond (shape)|diamonds]] (♦). The ranks include Ace, the numbers two through ten, and the face cards Jack, Queen, and King. A [[joker (playing card)|]] or two may or not be present. These cards are used for various games, such as solitaire, poker, blackjack, etc. Often with [[gambling]] involved.

If characters are [[playing games]] with these cards, remember to tag the card faces accordingly. However, if the cards are too difficult to discern (for example they're very far away, stacked atop each other, depicted as loose scribbles, or are a nonstandard playing card), you don't need to tag the faces of those cards.

Additionally, if the actual playing card were played rather than being a simple prop or motif (i.e simply being held by the character), the tag [[card game]] is also applicable.

h4. See also
* [[playing card print]]
* [[playing card theme]]
* [[List of playing card faces]]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playing_card]

title: booth_babe
body:
A [b]trade show model[/b] (also known as a convention model, trade show [[hostess]], booth companion, or booth professional; a term that has been used only in Japan is companion lady but today more often used is event companion (イベントコンパニオン)) is an assistant that works with a company's sales representatives at a trade show exhibit, working on the floor space or a [[booth seating]], and representing a company to attendees. Such models are used to draw in attendees and can provide them with basic information about product or services, and may be used to distribute marketing materials or gather customer information for future promotions. Attire varies and depends on the nature of the show and on the image the company would like to portray, and they sometimes wear wardrobe that is particular to the company, product, or service represented.

Trade show models are typically not regular employees of the company, but are hired as they make a company's booth more visibly distinguishable from other booths with which it competes for attendee attention. If needed, they can explain or disseminate information on the company and its product and service, and can assist a company in handling a large number of attendees which the company might otherwise not have enough employees to accommodate, therefore increasing the number of sales or leads resulting from participation in the show. The models can be skilled at drawing attendees into the booth, engaging them in conversation, and at spurring interest in the product, service, or company.

h4. See also
* [[race queen]]
* [[mascot]]
* [[revealing clothes]]
* [[company name]]
* [[clothes writing]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Promotional_model#Trade_show_model]
other_names: イベントコンパニオン

title: seo_akira
body:
The protagonist of the main story in [[Tsukihime]] PLUS-DISC, [i]"Alliance of Illusionary Eyes"[/i] (幻視同盟), and also makes an appearance in [[Kagetsu Tooya]]. An underclassmen and acquaintance of [[Tohno Akiha]] who attends Asagami Private Girls Academy.

She begins investigating mysterious murders and teams up with who she believes to be [[Tohno Shiki]] to help catch the killer, [spoiler][[Nise-Shiki|but who is in fact a serial murderer]][/spoiler].

Has the ability to predict the future and apparently loves to write [[Doujinshi]].

title: ark_royal_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the carrier HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i] (91). Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt bangs]] and a [[tiara]]-like [[hairband]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default (and only) outfit consists of a [[white shrug]], [[white corset]] that forms an [[overskirt]], [[black belt]], [[white shorts]], [[brown gloves|brown]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life hull as an overskirt, her carrier island and 113 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the back, her real-life funnel as a [[quiver]] to her right side, and her real-life [[flight deck]] as a bow. 

Similar to [[warspite (kancolle)|Warspite]], she has a prim and proper bearing, and mixes significant amounts of (generally well-spoken) English into her Japanese, although compared to Warspite, she has a more diligent personality, compared to Warspite's "regal bearing". 

h4. Appearance

* !post #3226138

h4. See also

* [[Ark Royal (Azur Lane)]]
** [[Ark Royal (META) (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Ark Royal (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Ark Royal (Blue Oath)]]

* "Wikipedia: HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Ark_Royal_(91)]

title: shiawase_na_ohimesama
body: From "VNDB":[https://vndb.org/v1570]: "Ritz is an ordinary boy, living a peaceful life. But he is actually a descendant of a royal family! One day, he is surprised to know the fact and he is offered to be next king since the former king passed away a few days ago. He doesn't know what's going on, but he is taken to a palace. He is astonished to hear that he will need to marry in a month...."

title: thorns_(arknights)
body:
[i]Thorns, Guard Operator of Rhodes Island, wastes not an ounce of energy, calculating each strike meticulously.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Isidor [tn](Tentative translation)[/tn]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Iberia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 17[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]177 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Born in the Iberian hinterland, Thorns left his hometown in the midst of local religious strife. After leaving, he was invited to join Rhodes Island. 

Knowledgeable in pharmacology and frequently experiments with various poisons and toxins, and is also exceptionally skilled in the Iberian swordsmanship technique known as [i]Destreza[/i]. His fencing teacher was [[Aulus (arknights)|]].

Easily misunderstood due to his blunt and uncaring demeanor, shrewd, and extremely forgetful regarding his appearance.

His motif is based on the black long-spined [[sea urchin]].

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Ishikawa Kaito]] (Japanese), Xu Xiang (Chinese), and Hong Bum-ki (Korean). His art designer is [[Huanxiang Heitu]].

h4. Skins
* !post #4044992: Default
* !post #4044993: Elite II
* !post #4556388: [[Thorns (Comodo) (Arknights)|Cómodo]]
* [[thorns (blade-cleaved tides) (arknights)|Blade-Cleaved Tides]]

h4. Alternate Forms

* !post #8518990: [[thorns the lodestar (arknights)|Thorns the Lodestar (Specialist)]]
* !post #8518992: Elite II

title: pagani
body:
Italian exclusive [[sports car|supercar]] manufacturer founded by Horacio Pagani, stationed in Modena, Emilia-Romagna. Notable for their eclectic design language and use of [i]carbotanium[/i], a compound of carbon fiber and titanium, which provides lightweight yet sturdy bodywork.

Pagani quickly acquired a positive reputation after launching their first model, the original [[Pagani Zonda|Zonda]], in 1999. The model went through several iterations and was joined by its successor, [[Pagani Huayra|Huayra]], in 2011. After several iterations of Huayra, Pagani announced its third-ever model, [[Pagani Utopia|Utopia]], in 2022 and produced its first examples in 2023.

Nowadays, Pagani enjoys a legendary status among the highest echelons of automotive.

Formerly a renowned mercenary, Gavial was forced to leave her tribe due to Oripathy and ultimately joined Rhodes Island to hone her healing skills. 

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]The Great Chief Returns[/i].

Her callsign comes from the [i]Gavialidae[/i] family of crocodiles.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[suwa ayaka|Ayaka Suwa]].

title: inkling_player_character
body:
A customizable player character from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. The player can choose between an [[Inkling Boy]] or [[Inkling Girl]].

This tag is for the Inklings that serve as the player's character, and for squid form Inklings (post #2028621). Do not use it for named characters such as [[Callie_(splatoon)|]] or [[Marie_(splatoon)|]].

[b]See [[Inkling]] (species) Wiki for a list of named Inklings (e.g. the Idols) and a section on how to differentiate between Inklings and [[Octoling]]s.[/b]

Remember to tag the general species tag for Inkling player characters as well as named characters such as the Idols or any OCs. With the exception being an Inkling as an [[alternate species]] (e.g. them being depicted as a human / [[humanization]]).

* !asset #25039313

title: elbow_sleeve
body:
A tightly wrapped sleeve around only the elbow, generally used to provide support for labor that stresses the arms. Typically worn by [[tennis]], [[basketball]], or [[volleyball]] players.

If it extends all the way to the wrist or shoulder, try using tags like [[arm warmers]], [[detached sleeves]], [[bridal gauntlets]] or [[elbow gloves]] instead.

* [[three-quarter sleeves]]

title: minsc
body:
A character and party member from [[Baldur's Gate]], originally debuting in [[baldur's_gate_1|the first game]]. A human ranger who is rarely ever found without his beloved miniature giant space hamster, [[boo_(baldur's_gate)|Boo]].

Minsc has been a fan-favorite of the Baldur's Gate franchise due to his chaotic yet unfailingly kind nature. He has been a party member in all three games, and a major recurring character in extended material.

title: godzilla_(shin)
body:
Also known as "Shin Godzilla". Lit. "True Godzilla".

The titular kaiju from [[Shin Godzilla]] who is a complete reimagination of the monster itself. Referred simply within the movie as "Godzilla".

This incarnation of Godzilla was born as a result of radiation from a classified nuclear waste dump site off the coast of Japan. As a result, the monster suffered from continuous and spontanous mutations akin to that of cancer cells, resulted in a constant pain. The monster [[Shin Godzilla's First Form|mutated]] [[Monster in Kamata|three]] [[Monster in Shinagawa|times]] before ending up in this form.

h4. See also

* [[Shin Godzilla's First Form]]
* [[Monster in Kamata]]

title: s&w_500
body: Formally the [b]Smith & Wesson Model 500[/b], a very-large-frame double/single-action [[revolver]] designed around the .500 S&W Magnum cartridge. S&W advertised the Model 500 as "the world's most powerful handgun" (a title formerly claimed by the company's .44 Magnum [[s&w m29|Model 29]] back in the 1970s) upon its release in 2003.

title: monster_in_kamata
body:
A [[spoilers|spoiler]] [[monster]]/[[kaiju]] in [[Shin Godzilla]], which made landfall in "Kamata, Ōta, Tokyo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamata,_Tokyo], given the fan name "Kamata-Kun".

It has amphibian characteristics and a "frilled shark":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frilled_shark]-like head. Red fluid is periodically oozing from its [[gills]].

[spoiler]Actually it was the second form of "Larva/Proto-[[Godzilla]]" in the story. It metamorphosed into [[Monster in Shinagawa]] near the Kita-Shinagawa Station.[/spoiler]

h4.See also

* [[Shin Godzilla's First Form]]
* [[Monster in Shinagawa]]
* [[Godzilla (shin)|]] (the fourth form) 
* [[Godzilla's Tail Crawling with Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Kamata-kun":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/kamata-kun]

A playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], a part of the Purifying Force of Babylonia. Voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

More mature in appearance amongst playable Constructs, Bianca has [[green eyes|olive green eyes]], and [[blonde hair|honey blonde]] [[very long hair]], a [[mole under eye|mole under left eye]], uses a [[bow (weapon)|]] as her weapon. In the Stigmata frame she has a [[pale skin|paler complexion]], [[purple eyes]] and platinum blonde hair, and uses a [[sword]] instead. body:
[[Duolingo]]'s green owl mascot, infamous for its usage in memes, where the mascot goes far beyond just pestering a user through smartphone notifications to ensure they don't slack off in their language studies in the app.

On February 11, 2025 the company announced the mascot's death.  On February 26, 2025 they announced their mascot was alive and that he had faked his own death.

title: megami_tensei
body:
The overarching Megami Tensei franchise of Japanese RPGs primarily developed and published by [[Atlus]]. The franchise consists of a series of Mainline games and numerous spin-off games and series. The first games are based on the novel series [[Digital Devil Story]].

Most games in the franchise, including some spinoff games/series, are standalone stories with recurring themes of philosophy, religion, occultism, and [[science fiction]]. The ability to recruit and use [[demon (megami tensei)|]]s in combat is common in multiple series and games.

h4. Series/Games

* [[Digital Devil Story]] - Original novel series
* [[Megami Tensei (Famicom)]] & [[Megami Tensei II]] - Original [[Famicom]] games
** [[Kyuuyaku Megami Tensei]] - Enhanced [[Super Famicom]] port of both games combined
* [[Shin Megami Tensei]] - Mainline series starting from the Super Famicom games

h4. Branch Series/Games

* [[Devil Summoner (series)|]] franchise
* [[Devil Survivor]] & [[Devil Survivor 2]]
* [[Digital Devil Saga]] duology
* Jack Bros
* [[Last Bible]]
* [[Majin Tensei]] series
* [[Persona]] franchise
* [[Shin Megami Tensei Devil Children]]

h4. See also

* [[Demon (Megami Tensei)]] - general tag for the recurring demons in the franchise
* [[List of Shin Megami Tensei Demons]] - list of recurring demons in the franchise

title: koopa_troopa
body:
[[Turtle]]-like enemies from the [[Mario (series)|]] series, with shells that come in many different colors. Flying variants are usually called [[Koopa Paratroopa]]s.

Koopas, along with [[Goomba]]s, are some of [[Mario]]'s most persistent foes. They're common enemies in the Mario series, usually displayed as foot soldiers of the Koopa Troop, under the direct leadership of [[Bowser]]. Since [[Super Mario 64]], however, many Koopas have appeared who do not work for Bowser (or any other villain), some of whom even act as allies to Mario during his adventures.

In Japan, the Troopas are referred to as "Nokonoko".

* !post #8044258

h4. See also
* [[Dry Bones]]
* [[Troopea]]

title: freight_train
body:
A freight train, also called a goods train or cargo train, is a railway [[train]] that is used to carry cargo, as opposed to passengers. Freight trains are made up of one or more [[locomotive]]s which provide propulsion, along with one or more railroad cars (also known as wagons) which carry freight. A wide variety of cargos are carried on trains, but the low friction inherent to rail transport means that freight trains are especially suited to carrying bulk and heavy loads over longer distances. [[Military]] train carrying military equipment also counts as freight train.

H4. Examples 
* !asset #23073832: [[Class C62]]: An example of a [[Steam Locomotive|Steam]] [[Locomotive]] Pulling a [[Freight Train]]
* !post #8076597: [[class EF64]]: An example of an [[Electric Locomotive|Electric]] [[Locomotive]] Pulling a [[Freight Train]]

title: alice_(megami_tensei)
body:
[i]"A ghost who appears as a small blonde girl. She seems young, but her magic powers are formidable. She is either the ghost of an English girl who died a sad death, or an evil spirit from a fevered writer's mind."[/i]
    —Devil Survivor 2 Compendium 

A recurring demon in the [[Megami Tensei]] series, she is the spirit of a young girl. Her design and abilities are inspired by the titular character of  [[alice (alice in wonderland)|Alice in Wonderland,]] while her personality derives from a spirit of European folklore, who is said to "befriend" misbehaving children by killing them. In the series, she will often ask the player to be her friend by "dying for her."

Debuting in [[Shin Megami Tensei I]], she takes the role of an NPC character; a deceased child who was resurrected by [[Nebiros (megami tensei)|]] and [[Belial (megami tensei)|]], aka "Uncle Black" and "Uncle Red."

h4. See also

* [[Alice (Alice in Wonderland)]]

h4. External links

* "Megami Tensei Wiki: Alice":http://megamitensei.wikia.com/wiki/Alice

title: william_birkin
body:
The secondary antagonist of the [i][[Resident Evil|]][/i] franchise.

William Birkin is one of Umbrella Corporation's head scientist and the father of [[Sherry Birkin]]. His most notable discovery was The G-Virus, which is considered to be the most dangerous bioweapon in history.

Birkin almost died in an operation led by U.S.S. operative [[HUNK (resident evil)|]], where he subsequently injected himself with a G-Virus sample, eventually mutating into a creature known as "[b]G[/b]" and killed most of his attackers, while accidentally spreading the t-Virus samples in the process, eventually leading to the infamous "Raccoon City incident."

h4.External links
* "Resident Evil Wiki":[https://residentevil.fandom.com/wiki/William_Birkin]

title: reggie_rocket
body: Regina "Reggie" Rocket (voiced by Shayna Fox) is a characterfrom [[Rocket Power]]: Otto's tomboyish and sassy older sister. Reggie is an aspiring publisher and author who writes and owns The 'Zine, a blog-type magazine that covers everything from extreme sports to "kid politics." Reggie is also an all-star athlete like her talented brother and while she is no less skillful and competitive as him, she has a calmer disposition and possesses greater maturity. Reggie tends to be the most sensible and sympathetic member of the gang and she also tends to be the voice of reason within the gang.

title: snk
body:
[b]SNK[/b], an acronym of [b]Shin Nihon Kikaku[/b] (新日本企画, lit. "New [[Japan]] Project"), is a legendary [[video game]] company, most notable for its powerful [[Neo Geo]] console from the 90s as well as various fighting games (like [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]]), and [[arcade]] shooters like [[Metal Slug]]. Its main rival is [[Capcom]].

SNK's predecessor [b]Shin Nihon Kikaku Corporation[/b] was founded in 1978 by Kawasaki Eikichi. In 1981, the name was informally shortened to SNK Corporation, which became the company's official name in 1986.

SNK merged with Playmore in 2003 after going bankrupt in 2001 to form [b]SNK Playmore[/b]. The company eventually changed its name back to [b]SNK[/b] in 2016.

title: void_(kirby)
body:
The absolute true form of [[Void Termina]]. Ancient texts imply that he is able to reincarnate from positive or negative energy. That along with attacks during his boss fight suggest a heavy connection to, among other things, [[Dark Matter (kirby)|]], [[Zero (kirby)|]], [[Dark Mind]], and even [[Kirby]] himself.

His most notable trait compared to his previous forms is [[rainbow_gradient|rainbow]] [[veins]] coursing through his body.

h4. External links

* "WiKirby: Void":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Void

title: busou_shinki
body:
A line of toys developed and marketed by [[Konami]]. It features highly posable 15 cm tall dolls named MMS (multi movable system) designed by Masaki Asai. Products are periodically released in pairs designed by popular manga artists and designers.

These dolls can be customized with various mechanical parts, usually consisting of some sort of weapons system. Each doll comes with an access code to unlock the character on the Battle Rondo MMO computer game. In-universe, the dolls are intended to be 1/1 scale 15 cm tall robots, which explains the [[minigirl]] fetishism associated with much of the fanart.

A 12-episode anime adaptation of the toyline aired from October to December 2012.

title: tengen_toppa_gurren-lagann_(mecha)
body:
* [b]Japanese:[/b] （天元突破グレンラガン） [Tengen Toppa Guren Ragan; lit. Heaven-Piercing Gurren Lagann]

The titular mecha of the [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann|series]], Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann is a manifestation of ludicrous amounts of [[Spiral Power]], controlled by [[Chouginga Gurren-Lagann]].

It was originally the largest mecha in the series, standing 10 million light-years high, until the introduction of [[Chou Tengen Toppa Gurren-Lagann]] in [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann: Lagann-hen|Lagann-hen]].

* It is used by the Great Gurren Brigade during the final battle against [[Antispiral]], who then pilots [[Grand Zamboa]].
* Due to its enormous size, it is piloted by all the members of the Great Gurren Brigade at the same time.

h4. See also

* [[Gurren-Lagann]]
* [[Arc Gurren-Lagann]]
* [[Chouginga Gurren-Lagann]]
* [[Chou Tengen Toppa Gurren-Lagann]]
other_names: 天元突破グレンラガン

title: shin_megami_tensei
body:
[b]Shin Megami Tensei[/b] (真・女神転生, lit. "True Goddess Reincarnation") is a series of RPGs developed and published by [[Atlus]]. It is originally based on the [[Digital Devil Story]] series of books, and the [[Famicom]] games developed by Atlus ([[Megami Tensei (Famicom)]] and [[Megami Tensei II]]).

The games are usually standalone stories taking place in post-apocalyptic worlds with recurring themes of philosophy, religion, occultism, and [[science fiction]]. 

Key elements of the gameplay include: (1) player-driven choices to place the protagonist in an ideological "alignment" (usually Law/Chaos/Neutral); (2) the recruitment and use of demons/creatures/dieties/historical figures from various mythologies and folklore. Colloquially by fans and in-game they are all usually just referred to collectively as demons. Use the general [[Demon (Megami Tensei)]] tag whenever they are featured in posts.

For Danbooru purposes this tag is exclusively used for the set of mainline games and [[Megami Tensei]] is used for the overarching franchise. See that wiki for a list of spinoff series.

h4. Mainline Games

* [[Shin Megami Tensei I]] (1992, [[Super Famicom]])
* [[Shin Megami Tensei II]] (1994, Super Famicom)
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: if...]] (1994, Super Famicom)
* [[Shin Megami Tensei NINE]] (2002, [[Xbox (original)|]])
* [[Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne]] (2003, [[Playstation 2]])
* [[Shin Megami Tensei IMAGINE]] (2007, PC)
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey]] (2009, [[Nintendo DS]])
* [[Shin Megami Tensei IV]] (2013, [[Nintendo 3DS]])
* [[Shin Megami Tensei IV Final]] (2016, Nintendo 3DS)
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: Liberation Dx2]] (2018, Mobile gacha)
* [[Shin Megami Tensei V]] (2021, [[Nintendo Switch]])
* [[Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance]] (2024, Nintendo Switch)

h4. See also

* [[List of Shin Megami Tensei demons]]
other_names: 真・女神転生シリーズ

title: miyadeguchi_mizuchi_(human)
body:
[[Miyadeguchi_Mizuchi|Miyadeguchi Mizuchi]] as a human, first appearing in chapter 42 of [[Foul_Detective_Satori|Foul Detective Satori]].

As a {{miko}}, Mizuchi spends much of her time hunting youkai. She wears her hair in a {{ponytail}} with a {{ribbon}} and {{hair_tubes| hair tubes}}. Can sometimes be seen {{smoking_pipe|smoking a pipe}}. Wears a {{kimono}} as well as a {{hakama}}. Her appearance and facial expressions resemble [[Hakurei_Reimu|Hakurei Reimu]].

[spoilers]100 years before the events of [[Foul_Detective_Satori|Foul Detective Satori]] Mizuchi was the {{miko}} of the Miyadeguchi shrine, however is killed by youkai in the very same chapter she's introduced.[/spoilers]

title: mori_kei
body:
Mori Kei (森系) or Mori Girl (森ガール) is a Japanese fashion style that centers around an appearance that is inspired by living in the woods.  It's basic aspects is having an appearance that combines clothing that appears natural, girly, layered, and loose.  The loose layers typically hide the body shape and give what is described as a "fluffy appearance" (ゆるふわ).

Clothing of this fashion typically are made of light or loose natural fabrics and normally feature embroidery and lace.  For layering, common garments are [[cardigan]]s, [[vest]]s, and knit [[scarf|scarves]] and [[shawl]]s.  Clothing colors are typically an off-white, earth tone, or other natural tones.  Floral tones are also sometimes used.  Accessories are frequently handmade or vintage.

Makeup and hairstyles are intended to match their natural appearance.  Makeup is typically used in minimal style with popular eye shadow options of beige, gold and pink; blush placed high and round; and eyebrows kept thick and natural.  Hairstyles frequently feature bangs and [[braid]]s.

h4. Examples

* !post #7474821 
* !post #4091073

h4. See also
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mori Kei":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_street_fashion#Mori_Kei]
* "Aesthetics Wiki: Mori Kei":[https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Mori_Kei]

title: flammable_symbol
body:
A symbol that indicates [[burning|flammable]] substances or [[chemicals]]. It consists of a [[fire]] pictogram (with a single bar under it) enclosed within a [[diamond (shape)|]], square, or [[triangle]].

Not to be confused with the oxidizer symbol, which has a circle within its [[fire|flame]].

title: yuu_(twisted_wonderland)
body:
The player character of [i][[Twisted Wonderland]][/i]. Their gender is unrevealed and their name can be changed by the player.

Typically they're depicted as having brown hair and brown eyes, but it's honestly up to the artist to choose a design for them.

Also referred to as "the Prefect" in lieu of calling them "the Player."

h4. Notable incarnations
* Enma Yuuken - Male Yuu from the Heartslabyul manga spinoff
* Hirasaka Yuuka - Female [[reverse trap]] Yuu from the Savanaclaw manga spinoff
* Mito Yuuta - Male [[fat]] Yuu from the Octavinelle manga spinoff
* Oujou Yuuna - Female [[kogal]] Yuu from the Scarabia manga spinoff
* Kuroki Yuuya - Male Yuu from the novelization series

title: ark_(tenchi_souzou)
body:
Main character in [[Tenchi souzou]] (also localized as Terranigma).

He is a [[1boy|boy]] with [[spiked hair]] wearing red [[baggy pants]] and a [[headband]] with a gem in it.

title: baggy_clothes
body:
Baggy clothes are loose-fitting, roomy, or oversized clothing, favored for its comfortable, relaxed fit and ease of movement. Baggy clothes tend to be wide.

If clothes are obviously too big for the wearer, use [[oversized clothes]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #4592100: [[baggy pants]]
* !post #7870573: baggy shirt and [[baggy shorts|shorts]]

h4. See Also:
* [[baggy pants]]
* [[baggy shorts]]
* [[oversized clothes]]
* [[loose clothes]]

title: tyrant_(resident_evil)
body:
A legacy of bioweapons created by Umbrella Corporation from the [i][[Resident Evil]][/i] franchise.

The Tyrants are often depicted as very tall (usually around 8 feet tall) [[muscular]] [[nude]] male [[zombie]] with an exposed [[heart (organ)|]] and long sharp [[talons]] as weapon. Many of them wear a black [[trench coat]] instead of being nude.

h4.Known Tyrants
* T-001
* T-002
* [[Mr. X (resident evil)|T-00]]

* T-A.L.O.S.

title: hoshirube_sho
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the group [[Dytica (nijisanji)|]], his name is meant to be read as [b]Hoshirube Shou[/b]. Designed by [[Miya (ete)|]]. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], and [[grey eyes]]. His default outfit comprises a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]], [[white pants]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[purple socks]], and black [[shoes]], with a [[multicolored clothes|multicolored]] [[long skirt]] fastened by a [[white belt]] and is seen holding a [[briefcase]]. He also has optional [[tentacles]] and [[tentacle hair]]. 

Worth noting is that he had an entirely different guise during his time in ANYCOLOR's [[Virtual Talent Academy]] (ex. post #8757724), sporting short grey hair instead of long purple hair.

h4. Costumes

h5. Official costumes with a model

* !post #8402161: [[Hoshirube Sho (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #8916054: [[Hoshirube Sho (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: Appraiser

h5. Costumes shared with other members

* !post #6933430: NijiFes: Group Violet

h4. See also

* [[Otomo (Hoshirube Sho)|]] (companion)

h4. External links

* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/@HoshirubeSho]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Show_SylveSTAR]

title: fear_and_loathing_in_las_vegas
body:
1971 satirical roadtrip novel by Hunter S. Thompson, more known for its 1998 satirical film adaptation, directed by Terry Gilliam of Monty Python fame.
The story follows its protagonist, [[Raoul Duke]], and his attorney, Doctor Gonzo, as they descend on Las Vegas to chase the American Dream through a drug-induced haze, all the while ruminating on the failure of the 1960s countercultural movement.
other_names: ラスベガスをやっつけろ

title: penny_(the_big_bang_theory)
body: Character from [[The Big Bang Theory]], Nebraska-born neighbor of Leonard and [[sheldon cooper|Sheldon]], moved there in the pilot. She aspires to be an actress, but to pay the bills she works as a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory. Initially friendly but distant to the guys, she grew to become One of the Boys. She has an average intelligence which is overshadowed by being around these super-geniuses, but displays common sense and social awareness that the others almost completely lack. Her relationship with both Leonard and Sheldon opened her up to the concept of higher thinking and she has found some difficulty going back to keeping "regular" people as company.

title: dark_magician
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 7
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Spellcaster
[i]The ultimate wizard in terms of attack and defense.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2500
[b]DEF:[/b] 2100

Signature monster of [[Muto Yugi|Muto Yugi]] in the [[yu-gi-oh!| Yu-Gi-Oh!]] manga, anime and collectible card game. He is the [[duel monster]] spirit of [[Mahado|Mahad]], one of the priests who served pharaoh [[Atem]] (Yugi's ancient Egyptian counterpart). His apprentice [[Mana (yu-gi-oh!)|]] also appears as a duel monster known as [[Dark Magician Girl]]. Known as "Black Magician" in Japanese.
other_names: ブラック・マジシャン
