title: melania_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Melania[/b] is a playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. Her father owns a security company that use Arcane skills. The company was forced to be bankrupt because it failed to protect a valuable item, ending the company and her father's life. Melania sense a foul play by her father's rival in this incident, so she assume an alternative identity [b]Great Thief Acey[/b] to steal items protected by her father's rival company, and to show their flaw as a security coompany. She is one of the main character in the event [b]The Theft of the Rimet Cup[/b]

She is voiced by [[Ueda Kana]] in Japanese, while the English voice actor are yet to be revealed...

h4. Appearance
* !post #6815595: Default
* !post #6815597: Insight II: The Ramirez Style
* !post #7243733: A Peaceful Night

title: twitter_cutting_game
body:
A [[meme]]tic variant of the [[Twitter strip game]] where a character wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] decorated with [[cut-here line]]s, and parts of the shirt are removed as certain like or retweet goals are achieved. The trend is sometimes parodied by having other things cut or removed.

The trend went viral in February 2025 with a tweet by [[Je o mo]], but earlier precursors to the meme were posted in July 2024 by [[Ixopod]] and in November 2023 by [[Radon86 Nya]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8813748: [[Je o mo]]
* !post #7897730: [[Ixopod]]
* !post #7274675: [[Radon86 Nya]]

h4. External links

* "Twitter: 2025 tweet (by Je o mo)":https://x.com/Je_o_mo/status/1886618181495820329
* "Twitter: 2024 tweet (by Ixopod)":https://x.com/ixopod/status/1815466544643915991
* "Twitter: 2023 tweet (by Randon86 Nya)":https://x.com/radon1014/status/1720767191702974637

title: crazy_smile
body:
A subset of [[smile]] where the character is seen smiling out of depravity rather than genuine happiness. Usually depicted either as the more extreme form of  [[smirk]] and [[smug]] or a wide open smile, both with distinctive sharp mouth corners poiniting upwards. Often accompanied with [[shaded face]] to emphasize the malicious nature of the expression.

Typically depicted with characters who were either [[yandere]], [[sadism|sadistic]], or [[crazy|mentally insane]]. Also somewhat overlaps with [[evil smile]], as a blend of these smile were also used to display the villiain's sheer cruelty.

h4. See also
* [[Evil smile]]

title: camellya_(wuthering_waves)
body:

title: eggette
body:
A [i][[Sonic (series)|]][/i] [[original]] fan character based off of [[Dr. Eggman]] as he appears in [i][[Sonic Mania]][/i]. Also sometimes called Omelette or Eggatha.

In Flying Battery Zone Act 2, Eggman fights the player in a spider [[mecha]] internally referred to as the "Spider Mobile". The original sprite she derived from simply had Eggman hanging upside down in the mecha. The trend only really began to take off due to "an interpretation":https://twitter.com/blackbookalpha/status/901971073096335360 by [[Alpha Gamboa]]; due to the fact that his visible face looked like that of a young girl in that state, the user had drawn the "head" of that sprite as a young girl with Eggman's trademarked glasses and a tiara reinterpreted from Eggman's nose, and her costume directly inspired from the Spider Mobile's design. From that point on, fans began to draw the character closely resembling that original version.

In most versions she's portrayed as an entity akin to [[Bowser Jr.]]: a bratty younger version of her "parent". However, whether she's actually related to Eggman or not is usually up for interpretation; in some she's blood by cloning, by her being a niece, or some coupling, and in others she's an [[android]] powered by a jewel on her head. In any case, she is just as technologically proficient as her originator and antagonizes [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] as well.

Do not mistake her for a younger genderswap of Dr. Eggman (see [[Eggma'am]] for a genderswap instead), nor a transformation in the vein of [[Super Crown]] fan characters (which often use the "-ette" suffix in English).

h4. External Links
* "Spider Mobile used as inspiration":[https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Spider_Mobile]
* "Original Post by Alpha Gamboa":[https://twitter.com/blackbookalpha/status/901971073096335360]
* "Eggette/Omelette | Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/eggette-omelette]

title: bowsette
body:
A fan transformation of [[Bowser]] using the [[Super Crown]], based on a comic by [[ayyk92]]. The trend went viral in September 2018.

Bowsette's appearance is a [[fusion]] of [[Princess Peach]] and [[Bowser]]. She typically has Peach's body (but often taller and stronger), hairstyle, [[sphere earrings]] and [[chest jewel]], with Bowser's [[turtle shell]], [[spiked tail]], [[sharp teeth]], [[horns]], and claw-like [[sharp fingernails]]. She usually wears a [[black dress|black]] [[strapless dress]] or [[strapless leotard]], sometimes with an open [[skirt]], with [[black thighhighs]].

An alternate version sometimes has [[red hair]] and [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]].

Her Japanese name is [i]Koopa-hime[/i] (lit. "Princess Bowser"). Other early names were Bowserette, Peacher, Princess Koopa, Peach Bowser, Princess Bowser, and... Beach.

title: elizabeth_tower
body:
The iconic [[clock tower]] of [[Westminster Palace]] in London, United Kingdom. Simply known as the Westminster Clock Tower before 2012 when it was renamed during the Diamond Jubilee of Queen [[Elizabeth II]]. It houses the world famous bell Big Ben (the name of which is sometimes incorrectly used for the tower).

h5. Appearance
* !post #3770226

Note that this tag is for the [[real life]] tower itself. For any other clock tower that is simply resembling the Elizabeth Tower, use the tag [[clock tower]] instead.

title: miyadeguchi_mizuchi
body:
[b]Jailbreak King[/b]

Miyadeguchi Mizuchi is [spoilers]the main antagonist and the true culprit[/spoilers] in [[Foul Detective Satori]], debuting in Chapter 16. 

She has [[sharp teeth]] and wears her hair in a [[ponytail]] with a [[skull hair ornament]]. She has [[hair tubes]] in front. Mizuchi is depicted with a [[striped shirt]] and a [[striped skirt]], similar to [[prison clothes]]. Fitting her title, she is decorated with [[cuffs]], [[shackles]], and [[chain]]s all over. Being a vengeful spirit, she has two [[ghost tail]]s in place of her lower legs, similar to [[Soga no Tojiko]].

In chapter 42 [spoilers] it is revealed that she used to be a shrine maiden 100 years ago before she was killed by youkai [/spoilers]
h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Mizuchi Miyadeguchi":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mizuchi_Miyadeguchi

title: kaiboukan_no._4_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]No. 4[/i]. Nicknamed "Yotsu". Character designed by [[Hozuka (kadokawa)|]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] that is tied into [[low twintails]] but with [[hair rings]] at the ends and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[sailor hat]], a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[blue_sailor_collar|blue]] [[sailor collar]], blue accents, and a [[yellow bow]], [[white socks]], and a pair of [[uwabaki]]. Pinned to her left chest is a [[searchlight]]. Her [[machinery]] basically consists of a miniature version of her namesake ship slung to her left like a bag, an [[adapted turret]], and several [[depth charge]]s, one around each thigh and several in a canister near her person.

The historical escort ship sunk two American submarines, USS [i][[Scamp_(kancolle)|]][/i] on November 11, 1944 and USS [i]Swordfish[/i] on January 4, 1945, although evidence for the latter is unclear. She was sunk by Royal Navy aircraft at Toba on July 28, 1945 and later salvaged and scrapped on June 30, 1948.

title: mutsu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Mutsu[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of her real-life bridge wings as a [[hairband]], [[white shirt|white]] [[midriff]] in the [[Japanese clothes|Japanese style]], [[white gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[red thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]], unlike her sister [[Nagato (Kancolle)|]], consists only of her four 41 cm twin gun mounts held to her waist and to a funnel on her back, plus a [[chain]] and [[anchor]] wrapped around her left leg.

She is sometimes drawn as a [[Mutsu (Snail)|snail]] due to her horn-like headgear.

Infamous for once having the lowest luck in the game (3, 6 at Kai, a more respectable 16 at Kai2), stemming from her historical demise (she suffered a magazine explosion which cut her in half while at Hashirajima fleet anchorage). Because of her fate, she is often depicted as being easily exploded with the slightest movement (sneezing, coughing, getting excited...).

title: massachusetts_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Massachusetts[/i] (BB-59). Character design by [[Zeco|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streak]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]], albeit just like her sister [i]South Dakota[/i], looks slim relative to the large rigging she wears. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[midriff]], [[black necktie]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as her sister's, sporting her three historical 406 mm triple gun mounts and ten 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP]] gun mounts on a hull that is painted in Measure 22, her real-life camouflage scheme in the Naval Battle of Casablanca. She also carries her real-life mainmast with SG and SC-1 [[radar]]s on top as a [[staff]]. 

h4. Skins

* !post #5665309: Base
* !post #5661307: Kai
* !post #8307732: [[massachusetts (yukata) (kancolle)|Yukata]]

h4. History
In real life, [i]Massachusetts[/i] was the only one of the class to have initially seen frontline service in the Atlantic/Mediterranean theaters, bombarding Casablanca in November 1942 (the setting of the 2022 Summer event, including her gunnery exchange with [i][[Jean Bart (Kancolle)|]][/i], in anchor at that time). She was only transferred to the Pacific in early 1943 to replace her sister [i]South Dakota[/i] (then headed stateside for repairs), seeing action escorting the carrier forces.

Post-war, she was decommissioned in 1947, but it took until 1965 for her to become a museum ship.

h4. [i]South Dakota[/i]-class battleships

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Hoshiakari-designed class uniform: a [[blue dress]] with a [[sailor collar]], a [[white shirt]] under the dress, blue striped [[necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[Mary Janes]]. 

Her rigging is shared with her sisters: a handheld 12 cm single gun, [[depth charge]]s strapped to a [[brown belt]], and her aft hull (includes depth charge throwers, mast, Type 13 [[radar]], funnel, bridge) to her back. In kai form, she also gains two 25 mm single AA guns on [[thigh strap]]s.

title: maikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Maikaze[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[parted bangs]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit is the Konishi-designed [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform: a black [[vest]] over a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress_shirt|dress shirt]], [[white gloves]], a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Each class member has a different color for their neckwear, hers is a [[red bowtie]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back with 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount, a second 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]], and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on [[thigh strap]]s. 

Her name means "whirlwind", but when read literally it means "Dancing Wind", so as a joke and primary character trait, she's treated as a character who loves [[dancing]]. She is constantly excited and upbeat, often talks about wanting to dance with the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]], refers to combat as a 'dance' as well, and says she dislikes gloomy things.

h4. Appearance

body:

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into a [[low ponytail]] with [[hair flaps]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue serafuku|blue]] [[serafuku]] with a [[white neckerchief]] and [[blue sailor collar]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] under a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], brown [[shawl]], [[white thighhighs]], [[headgear]] which incorporates a white [[headband]], and a [[whale hair ornament]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a funnel piece to her back with two hull pieces (containing 14 cm twin gun mounts and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s), [[drum (container)|oil barrel]], and a crate containing potatoes. 

Like [[Taigei (kancolle)|]] before her and perhaps because of her function, she comes off as caring and [[motherly]], specially towards the submarines.

title: hatsuzuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hatsuzuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Nakajima Megumi]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a side [[hair_flaps|flap]], [[hachimaki]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[black bodysuit]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on platforms, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (hatsuzuki's)|]]. 

Hatsuzuki is a "bokukko", and refers to herself with the "typically young boy" pronoun of "boku". She has a stoic, serious, and taciturn personality, similar in some respects to [[Kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]], however she has a far more selfless and humble personality. This is likely due to all her service escorting, and her final mission in Leyte Gulf ending in a "last stand" sacrifice so the survivors of [i]Zuikaku[/i] could escape.

title: ayanami_(kancolle)
body: The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ayanami[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. 11th of the Special Types, 1st of her own class. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]]. She and [[shikinami (kancolle)|Shikinami]] wear a brown version of the Fubuki-class [[serafuku]]. On her second remodel, her uniform becomes black with red stripes on white and she gains a searchlight. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[side_ponytail|sidetail]]. Said sidetail becomes as long as she is tall once in her [[Ayanami Kai Ni (kancolle)|second remodel]]. This sometimes leads to references to [[Gon-san]]. h4. Skins * !asset #22669225: Default * !post #3226202: [[Ayanami Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] * !post #2804882: [[ayanami (yukata) (kancolle)|Summer 2017]] h4. History She is termed the "demon goddess" of the Third Torpedo Squadron (DesRon3) due to her performance in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal, where she alone formed one 'prong' of a three-pronged attack. She assisted in the sinking of three destroyers (heavily damaging a fourth) and traded fire with [[South Dakota (Kancolle)|]] before she was severely damaged and sunk by [[Washington (Kancolle)|]]. h4. title: akizuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akizuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with a [[hachimaki]] and tied to a [[ponytail]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white socks]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life fire control director as a ponytail tie, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan]]. She also carries four spare 10cm barrels in a [[thigh strap]] holster on her right leg, referencing the 10cm Type 98 gun's short barrel life requiring frequent barrel replacement.

She appears somewhat older than most of the other destroyers, having a significantly larger displacement compared to the earlier models as historically, her class was meant for anti-air duties and needed a larger hull for more anti-air guns.

h4. Skins

* !post #3228244: Base art
* !post #2470733: [[Akizuki (yukata) (kancolle)|Yukata]]
* !post #2987849: [[Akizuki (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]] (unreleased)

h4. Personality
Akizuki's hourly lines reflect how, owing to being a later-war destroyer, her crew typically had to suffer through having a shortage of rations, where meat was rarely served.  As a result, there are often jokes of her being in awe of being served even "ordinary food,":/posts/1945272 and having her "mind blown by something luxurious.":/posts/2054386 (pool #10990)

She has been nicknamed "ducky" due to alternate Kunrei-shiki (official) Japanese romanization rendering her name as [i]Akiduki[/i] instead of the Hepburn form (which Danbooru currently uses). Together, Akizuki and her sisters [[Teruzuki (kancolle)|Teruzuki]] and [[Hatsuzuki (kancolle)|Hatsuzuki]] are sometimes referred to as "the duckies".

h4. External links

title: kuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kuma[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[huge ahoge|huge]] zizag [[ahoge]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with Tama and Kiso, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[white shorts]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, foremast, and funnels to her back, 14 cm gun mounts on the rig, and two 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles.

As "Kuma" means "bear" and her catchphrase is "kuma", which she almost always appends to the end of her sentences, she is often depicted with [[bear]]-like qualities or dressed in a [[bear costume]]. She is most often paired with her younger sisters, especially [[Tama (Kancolle)|]]. Additionally, there's a joke about the "Kuma Fleet", which also includes [[Abukuma (kancolle)|]], [[Chikuma (kancolle)|]], [[Kumano (kancolle)|]], [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]] and occasionally [[Noshiro (kancolle)|]] (see post #1543570).

Kuma was last of her class to be given her [[Kuma Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]] second remodels. She is sometimes grouped with [[Tenryuu (Kancolle)|]] and [[Shiratsuyu (Kancolle)|]] who also received their second remodels before being remodeled themselves.

title: ikazuchi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ikazuchi[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a [[hairclip]]s on her left, [[brown eyes]], and a [[fang]]. Her default outfit is the Special-Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]]), but with the addition of a "III" pin unique to the [i]Akatsuki[/i]-class. The "III" is on the right side of her collar.

An excitable girl, she is often shown with her sister ship [[Inazuma (kancolle)|]]. The two are extremely similar in appearance; having been laid down on the same day they are depicted as [[twins]]. She is also often depicted as very doting to the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]], many a times spoiling them beyond help (her Pixiv nicknames "Loli-Okan" and "Useless Admiral Maker" refer to this side of her). Sometimes depicted as being clingy, to the point of being [[yandere]], leading to the nickname "Black Thunder" among the fandom.

title: tama_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Tama[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[pink hair]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sisters [[Kuma (kancolle)|]] and [[Kiso (kancolle)|]], is composed of a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[white shorts]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and funnels to her back, 14 cm gun mounts to her left, [[aircraft catapult]] to her right, and two 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles. 

As her name is commonly given to [[cat]]s, she meows as a verbal tic and is often depicted as a [[cat girl]] or acting like a [[cat]]. She is very soft spoken and is usually depicted as rather laid back. True to her cat-like nature, she is often portrayed sleeping or lounging, especially under a [[kotatsu]]. She is most frequently paired with her sisters, especially [[Kuma (Kancolle)|]].

title: teruzuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Teruzuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Komatsu Mikako]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]] in [[twin braids]] with [[propeller_hair_ornament|propeller hair ornaments]] on the tips, and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white socks]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (Teruzuki's)|]] with [[ammunition belt]]s linked to her [[thigh strap]]s (both have a closed eye, one of them is biting a bullet as if it was a cigar).

Teruzuki has a very soft-spoken tone and nervous personality, and looks up to her sister-ship [[akizuki (kancolle)|Akizuki]]. When damaged, her worries about torpedoes and desire to jettison her own munitions stem from how detonation of her depth charges sank her in real life.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Air Defense Princess]].

title: fubuki_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Fubuki (Kancolle)|]]'s second remodel.

Her white [[serafuku]] is retained but she opts for a [[black sailor collar]] with red stripes, while she also wears a [[black skirt]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] with red stripes: the default Special Type Kai Ni uniform.

As for her [[rigging]], she replaces her original 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type A with a 10 cm twin DP gun mount and wears a type 94 anti-aircraft fire detector on her left wrist. She also gains a [[radar]] on her mast. Her use of this gear is hypothetical, however. She was sunk in the battle of Cape Esperance (October 1942) before she ever had a chance to be refit with AA weaponry. Unlike other hypothetical second remodels, she does not require a blueprint for the remodel.

She gained her second remodel with the January 9th 2015 update (timed with the premiere of the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]]) and thus became the first starter ship to have one.

title: fubuki_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Fubuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a small [[ponytail]] and [[sidelocks]] in front, [[black eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit, the Special-Type uniform, is a [[serafuku]] comprising a [[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast carried as a form of backpack, while carrying two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap|thigh straps]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount Type A as a [[handgun]]. She has an earnest and diligent personality, but lacks any notable quirks or notable personality traits, and is often considered very plain. She is the viewpoint character of the official 4koma [i]Fubuki-chan Gambarimasu![/i], as well as the leading role in the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]] adaptation. h4. title: toji_no_miko:_kizamishi_issen_no_tomoshibi
body:
Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi was a turn-base gacha RPG developed by [[Square Enix]] for iOS and Android (and was later ported for the PC through Shift for docomo platform). The game was released on March 18, 2018 and ended on October 29, 2021.

This game features a new main character and a new story, while also had recurring characters from its [[Toji no Miko|anime]].

title: fingersmile
body:
Pushing up one or both sides of one's [b]own mouth[/b] with fingers to form a smile.  Frequently associated with [[Yin (darker than black)|]] from [[Darker Than Black]] and [[Marnie (pokemon)|]] from [[Pokemon]].

If the fingersmile is applied to other, it should be [[forced smile]]. If the smile is not formed by fingers, and the fingers are simply placed on face, it should be [[fingers to cheeks]].

title: satsuki_yomi
body:
Character in [[Toji no Miko]]. One of four [[origami yukari|Yukari's]] bodyguards. An expresionless girl that can't used a katana properly, making her willing to do anything to obtain power. [spoiler]Her body has been injected with Noro to making her powerful, thus making her original black hair turned white. With that, she use a unique fighting style which requires her to injure herself in order to produce a small pack of [[aratama (toji no miko)|Aratama]] that fights for her. After injecting too much Noro as a way to fight against [[yanase mai|Mai]] and [[itomi sayaka|Sayaka]] in episode 11, she collapsed and later deceased [/spoiler]. Voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]].

She has a [[medium hair|medium]] [[white hair|white]]/[[grey hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[colored tips|tip]] styled in [[bob cut]] and a [[brown eyes]]. Her katana is Suijingiri Kanemitsu and she use Shinjin-ryu as her fighting style.

title: apolly_bay
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]Apolly Bay[/b] is a veteran [[AEUG]] mobile suit pilot and one of [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s loyal wingmen. His [[mobile_Suit|MS]] of choice is the [[Rick Dias]], initially painted black and grey, then red.

[spoilers]Apolly used to be a [[Zeon]] MS pilot (Real name: Andy) during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. He dies in one of the last space battles of The Gryps War, killed when his Rick Dias was destroyed by [[Jerid Messa]]'s [[Byalant]] while taking part in [i]Operation Maelstrom[/i].[/spoilers]

title: credit_card
body:
A card one uses to make purchase on credit, usually containing magnetic stripes to be read by computer systems.

The concept of credit cards is in which one buys goods & services first, paying off the costs later (and varying amounts of interest, usually on a monthly basis). First introduced in the US during the 50s, the widespread of them since then allowed for greater growth of the economy, although it also driven up household debt in the meantime. Most people in the developed world has at least one these days, usually several. Many credit card companies offer various reward points for their costumers in order to encourage spending. Some companies charge a transaction fee onto merchants, which made certain businesses to not accept them.

Credit card companies can also offer various card levels which clients can access depending on conditions, such as net worth, credit quality, and spending requirements, with each level reflective of the client's wealth and benefits which they receive from it, going from non-colored standard cards, gold, platinum, and finally [[black credit card|black]].

title: megami_tensei_(famicom)
body:
The first entry in the [[Megami Tensei]] series, released in 1987. It is an adaptation of the book "[[Digital Devil Story]]: Megami Tensei" in the form of a first-person RPG. It would be followed up by [[Megami Tensei II]] in 1990, which would be partially remade in the form of 1992's [[Shin Megami Tensei I]], setting in stone the brand and series from then on.

Megaten I and II would also see an enhanced Super Famicom port in 1995, entitled [[Kyuuyaku Megami Tensei]].
other_names: デジタル・デビル・ストーリー女神転生
デジタル・デビル物語女神転生

title: megami_tensei_ii
body:
The second entry in the [[Megami Tensei]] series, released in 1990, following up the original from 1987. Unlike the [[megami tensei (famicom)|original]], which adapted the events of the book "Digital Devil Story: Megami Tensei", this game follows an original plot, set 35 years after a nuclear apocalypse devastated the world and permanently opened a portal to the demon realm.

This game would be partially remade in the form of 1992's [[Shin Megami Tensei I]], setting in stone the brand and series from then on. Megaten I and II would also see an enhanced Super Famicom port in 1995, entitled [[Kyuuyaku Megami Tensei]].
other_names: デジタル・デビル・ストーリー女神転生II

title: digital_devil_story
body:
The book series from which [[Megami Tensei]] emerged from, derived from the subtitle of the first book.

The original series consists of Digital Devil Story: Megami Tensei (Goddess Reincarnation), Digital Devil Story 2: Mato no Senshi (Warrior of the Demon City), and Digital Devil Story 3: Tensei no Shuuen (Demise of the Reincarnation). The story of the book series would see high school student [[Nakajima Akemi]] develop a computer program, which would summon demons from another realm. The program would go out of control and unleash a horde lead by Lucifer, whom Akemi has to defeat with the help of [[Shirasagi Yumiko]], a transfer student that became interested in him [spoiler]and is the titular Megami Tensei. By the end of the third book, Akemi and Yumiko lose against Lucifer.[/spoiler]

The first Digital Devil Story would spawn an OVA adaptation, and two different games - one developed by Telenet for Japanese computers, and the far more famous Atlus game for the original [[Megami Tensei (Famicom)|Famicom]]. The follow-up of the Atlus game, [[Megami Tensei II]], would carve out its own story and diverge from the books substantially, ultimately leading to [[Shin Megami Tensei I]]. The two Famicom games would receive an enhanced Super Famicom port in [[Kyuuyaku Megami Tensei]]. References to the original Digital Devil Story can still be found in later Megaten games.

title: we_bare_bears
body: We Bare Bears is an American animated series created by Daniel Chong for [[Cartoon Network]]. The show follows three bear brothers, named Grizzly, Panda and Ice Bear, and their awkward attempts at integrating with the human world in the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: johnny_bravo_(series)
body: Johnny Bravo is an American animated comedy television series created by Van Partible for [[Cartoon Network]]. The second of the network's Cartoon Cartoons (after [[Dexter's Laboratory]]), it aired from July 14, 1997, to August 27, 2004. The titular Johnny Bravo (voiced by Jeff Bennett), who is loosely based on [[Elvis Presley]] and James Dean, is a blonde-haired sunglasses-wearing, muscular, and dimwitted young man who lives with his mother and attempts to get women to date him, though he always falls short because of his actions. He ends up in bizarre situations and predicaments, often accompanied by celebrity guest characters such as Donny Osmond or [[Adam West]]. Throughout its run, the show was known for its adult humor and pop culture references.

title: randy_marsh
body: Randall "Randy" S. Marsh is a fictional character in the American adult animated sitcom [[South Park]] and serves as the series' comic relief. He is the most prominent parent on the series and a married father who raises his son Stan and daughter [[shelley maRsh|Shelley]] along with his wife Sharon in the fictional town of South Park, Colorado. Randy's first name and original job as a geologist are derived from the series co-creator Trey Parker's father, and Parker describes Randy as "the biggest dingbat in the entire show". According to the season 16 episode "Reverse Cowgirl", the Marsh home address was 260 Avenue de los Mexicanos until their move to Tegridy Farms in season 22.

title: kai_shiden
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] [[mecha]] TV series from 1979. Also appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985).

[b]Kai Shiden[/b] is a former civilian refugee and later member of the [[White Base]] junior crew who pilots the [[Guncannon]] [[mobile suit]] during The One Year War. Originally evasive about the war, Kai was initially a bit hateful and resented by [[Bright Noa]] and the rest of the White Base crew. On the surface, he was a jovial character, often sarcastic and lying to hide his embarrassment. However, war experiences make him grow and mature fast, changing his devious ways by the end of the conflict.

Years later he became a famous journalist. [spoiler]During this time, Kai took part in [i]The Gryps War[/i] as a [[aeug|Karaba]] intelligence officer spying on the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] bases on Earth. There he met and became friends with [[Reccoa Londe]] during a mission infiltrating the Titans base at Jaburo.[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Miharu Ratokie]]

title: help:posts
body:
A post represents a single image that's been uploaded. Each post can have many [[help:tags|tags]], [[help:comments|comments]], [[help:notes|notes]], and a single [[help:artist commentary|artist commentary]]. Each post may also belong to multiple [[help:pools|pools]]. If you have an [[help:users|account]], you can also add a post to your [[help:favorites|favorites]] or [[help:favorite groups|favorite groups]].

h4. Searching

Searching for posts is straightforward. Simply enter the tags you want to search for, separating tags by spaces and words [i]within[/i] tags by underscores. For example, searching for {{blonde_hair blue_eyes}} will return every post that has both the [[blonde hair]] tag [b]and[/b] the [[blue eyes]] tag.

Be aware that tags for characters and series are usually known by their original Japanese names, not their English names. For example, the tag on Danbooru for [i]The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya[/i] is [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]]. See [[help:tags]] for more information.

Danbooru also offers many metatags that let you further refine your search. Metatags allow you to query on things like image width, height, score, uploader, upload date, and more. Consult the [[help:cheatsheet|cheat sheet]] for a complete list of what you can do.

Finally, note that Members are limited to two tags per search. See [[help:users]] for details.

h4. Tag List

In both the post listing page and on individual post pages you'll notice a list of tags with links next to them. Here's an explanation of what the links are:

[b]?[/b]
    This links to the wiki page for the tag. If the tag is an [[help:artists|artist]] type, then you'll be redirected to the artist page.

[b]950[/b]
    The number next to the tag represents how many posts there are. This isn't always the total number of posts for that tag. If you're searching for a combination of tags, this will be the number of posts that have the tag AND the current tag query. If you're not searching for anything, this will be the number of posts found within the last twenty-four hours.

[b]Color[/b]
    Some tag links may be colored green, purple, or red. Green means the tag represents a character. Purple means the tag represents a copyright (things like anime, manga, games, or novels). Red means the tag represents an [[help:artists|artist]].

When you're not searching for a tag, by default the tag list will show the most popular tags within the last three days. When you are searching for tags, the tag list will show related tags, sorted by relevancy.

h2#mode-menu. Mode Menu

[[help:users|Gold and above users]] will notice a menu labeled "Mode" in the sidebar on the main listing page. This menu lets you make several changes without ever leaving the listing page. Simply select an option and whenever you click on a thumbnail, the action will be performed in the background.

[b]View[/b]
    This is the default mode. Whenever you click on a thumbnail, you'll go to that post.

[b]Edit[/b]
    Whenever you click on a thumbnail, an edit box will appear. Here you can easily change the post's tags from the listing page without opening the entire post.

[b]Tag script[/b]
    Write a tag script into the text box that appears, and it will be applied when you click on the thumbnail of a post. This allows you to quickly add or remove tags to many posts at once. See [[help:tag scripts]] for details on creating tag scripts.

[b]Favorite[/b]
    Whenever you click on a thumbnail, that post will be added to your list of [[help:favorites|favorites]].

[b]Unfavorite[/b]
    Whenever you click on a thumbnail, that post will be removed from your list of [[help:favorites|favorites]].

h4. Borders

In the listing page, you will notice that some thumbnails have a border. The meaning of this border depends on the color.

[b]Blue[/b]
    The post is [[about:mod_queue|pending moderator approval]] or was [[about:mod_queue|flagged for deletion]].

[b]Black[/b]
    The post is [[about:mod_queue|deleted]].

[b]Green[/b]
    The post has [[help:post relationships|child posts]].

[b]Yellow[/b]
    The post has a [[help:post relationships|parent]].

title: producer_(idolmaster)
body:
The Producer is the unseen player character of [[idolmaster|THE iDOLM@STER]] series. While never shown to the player in the games, he is generally implied to be an adult male in his early twenties. In illustrations he is nearly always depicted wearing a [[suit]] and [[necktie]], where as his face is obscured, missing, or symbolically replaced altogether.

In addition to the in-game character, the title of Producer is also used to refer to fans as a whole, and for fans of a particular [[idol]]. In the latter case, they are usually referred to by the idol's name first, with Producer being shortened to just "P" (e.g. HarukaP, RankoP, and so on.).

This tag serves as both an umbrella tag for the character's various incarnations as well as the non-specific form from the games or fan materials.

title: sentinel_(yuusha_de_aru)
body:
A Sentinel (防人, Sakimori) is a title given to a young maiden in [[yuusha_de_aru|Yuusha De Aru]] franchise who was once a hero candidate and had the truth about the world beyond the wall revealed to them and were ordered to investigate the outside by the command of [[taisha|Taisha]]. They are armed with battle suit, gun and shield depending on the role of gunner or defender. Some Sentinel also has the Mankai ability like the Hero.

title: type_97_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Chinese [[QBZ-97]] [[assault rifle]], the export version of QBZ-95, in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Type 97 has very [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] in [[twintails]] and [[red eyes]]. Her normal costume consists of a [[white shirt]] with black [[double-breasted]] [[underbust]], white [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and black [[boots]] as well as a black [[cape]].

Portrayed as a cheerful yet somehow childish girl eager for the outside world, but under strict guardianship by her older sister, [[Type 95 (girls' frontline)|]]. This reflects the real-world plight that the QBZ-97 never found itself popular in the civilian market as expected, due to its mixed reputation and import restrictions.

In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], Type 97 appears as [[Jiangyu (neural cloud)|]], and [[Jiangyu (girls' frontline 2)|she does so too]] in the sequel, [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]].

Voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 
Illustrated by [[Kishiyo]] (Original, Peony), and [[Nagu]] (Late for School, Gretel the Witch).

title: love_u_my_friends
body:
Love U my friends is the title track and tenth song on [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club|Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]'s 2nd album.

The costume for the song consists of a [[frilled shirt|frilled]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] with a [[criss-cross halter]], [[frilled straps]], [[rainbow order|rainbow]] stripes and [[flower]]s around the neckline, a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[miniskirt]], a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[rainbow skirt|rainbow-colored]] [[overskirt]] with [[flower]]s around the waist, [[frilled thigh strap]]s, [[white thighhighs]], [[white gloves]] ad [[wristband]]s and a [[hair ornament]] consisting of a [[hair bow]] and [[hair flower|flowers]].

In typical Love Live! fashion the costume is color coded for each member, with the main skirt, garters, halter and hair ornament matching each idol's associated  color.

title: binbou_miko_(kakikorori)
body:
Formerly known as [[Hakurei Reimu]], she used to be the shrine maiden of the Hakurei shrine and main character of the [[Touhou]] series, but now she's [[corruption|corrupted]] into a monster and powerful goddess. Thinking "I want to get out of [[poverty]]. I want money" while being [[transformation|transformed]], twists her motivations into valuing poverty over everything:

[quote]"Being poor is good and makes people happy, thus all people should be poor".[/quote]

The busy miko found one day a strange man, who offered her to end her financial problems. He tricks her and corrupts the miko into what she became now, the head of the Sect of Binbou. She has the ability to go around [[mind control|brainwashing]] people into joining her sect, turning them into dirty poor unglorious versions of their former selves.

She has [[white lips]], [[white eyes|eyes]], and [[colored eyelashes|eyelashes]]; [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], a [[red mask]] in the shape of a [[torii]] and a [[donation box (costume)|donation box]] at the same time (which also works as her hat), and [[colored skin|purple-]][[dark skin|brownish skin]]. What is left from her original [[nontraditional miko|miko outfit]] is a [[red skirt|red]] [[microskirt]] and her [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]] in a [[grey sleeves|grey]] and [[patch|patched]] form. She now wears [[geta]], [[white thighhighs]], red [[frilled thigh strap]]s, a [[brown sash|brown]] [[wood]] [[obi]] with two [[coin on string|coins]] knotted over it and a [[bra]] made of [[holed coin|golden cash coins]]. A [[shimenawa]] hangs from her hips, with a large [[medallion]] and [[shide]] hanging from it, the former with the word "POVERTY" carved in it. She has what used to be her [[gohei]], transformed into the Binbou Stick with the word "[s]GOLD[/s]" in its top. 

[quote]"Ufufu ... My name is Binbou Miko. I came here to spread Binbou."[/quote]

Created by [[kakikorori]].

title: palutena
body:
A major character in the [[Kid Icarus]] series. The Goddess of Light, rightful ruler of Angel Land, and patron deity to [[pit (kid icarus)|Pit]]. She is kindhearted, benevolent and cheerful, as opposed to the cruel, malevolent and cynic [[Medusa (kid icarus)|]].

Palutena serves as the leader of her army, and while she never physically aids Pit on the battlefield, she does everything in her power to support her servant from the sidelines. However, although she is demure and calm, she has a [[trolling|trollish]] side to her, constantly pulling [[prank]]s on Pit or putting him through minorly dangerous situations; nevertheless, she does care for him, to [[motherly]] levels. However, she's less lenient at punishing evil than her servant Pit, hinting to a dark side of her.

As of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], her attire is usually comprised of an elegant [[strapless dress]], with a [[chiton]] hanging from a gold [[pendant]]. Her dress has a [[side slit|slit]] on her left side, and wears a [[single thighhigh|single]], [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] to cover her left leg. She wears [[vambraces]] and [[armlet]]s to cover her arms, as well as [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]], the left one of which has a leg wrapping. She also wears a [[laurel crown|laurel]] [[tiara]] on her head with a set of small [[forehead jewel]]s, and [[multiple belts|two belts]] where multiple pieces of [[jewelry|gold]] dangle from. In terms of body shape, she has [[long legs|long]], shapely [[legs]] and [[thighs]], and [[medium_breasts|medium]]/[[large breasts]].

title: lady_flat_chest_(gaki_kyonyuu)
body:
An [[original|original character]] in the [[Gaki Kyonyuu]] series by [[kaedeko_(kaedelic)|Kaedeko]].

Introduced in post #4444608. She has [[yellow eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] stylized with [[hair over one eye]], and a [[flat chest]].

Her [[serafuku]] [[school uniform]] consists of a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief|black]] [[neckerchief]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[suspender_skirt|suspenders]] [[skirt]], and [[white pantyhose]].

She is classmates with [[Sasaki Kanna]].

The [[school uniform]] worn by students of the Dream Academy (ドリームアカデミー) in [i][[Aikatsu!]][/i].

The uniform consists of:
* A [[white shirt]].
* A [[red bowtie]].
* A [[black jacket]].
* A [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt]].
* [[Brown boots|Brown]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]] with a [[red bow]] on them.

On winter, students also wear a [[brown jacket]].

The [[summer uniform]] consists of:
* A [[white shirt]].
* A [[red bowtie]].
* A [[yellow vest|yellow]] [[sweater vest]].
* A [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt]].
* [[Black socks|Black]] [[kneehighs]] with a yellow [[single stripe]] on it.
* [[Black shoes|Black]] [[loafers]].

title: yukikaze_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yukikaze[/i] (雪風) in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Yuuki Kana (voice Actor)|]].

Yukikaze has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[cat ears]] with [[animal ear fluff]] and [[orange eyes]]. She wears several [[black bow|black bows]] in her hair as well as around both arms. Her outfit consists of a modified [[serafuku]], where she has a [[crop top]] and a [[black sailor collar]]. The lower portion consists of a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] which is attached to the top by means of a nondescript black strap. She wears [[ribbon-trimmed legwear|ribbon-trimmed]], [[white thighhighs]] and short, [[rudder footwear|rudder]] high heels with a cat's paw under each shoe.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single quad [[torpedo tubes|torpedo tube]], a single twin [[ship turret|turret]] and a [[smokestack]].

title: yuudachi_(azur_lane)
body:
Personification of the fourth ship of the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class destroyers, [i]Yuudachi[/i] (夕立), in [[Azur Lane]].

Introducing herself as the "Mad Dog of Solomon", her personality takes the dog-like mannerisms that fans gave her [[yuudachi (kancolle)|Kantai Collection counterpart]] and dials them up even further. Yuudachi is highly aggressive, often growling and even outright howling. Like many dogs, she is also food-motivated, and often cannot stop thinking about the consumption of freshly-cooked meat.

Character design by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Takamori Natsumi]].

Yuudachi has [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]] tied into at least one [[side ponytail]] on her right and a [[braid]] from her left sidelock. She has [[red eyes]], [[wolf ears]] with metal plates over the outside, and a [[wolf tail]]. Like Shigure, her outfit consists of a modified [[serafuku]], with a white [[crop top]], [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[black sailor collar]], and a [[red ribbon]]. Below the waist, she wears a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[high heels]]. Additionally, she has [[fingerless gloves]] with red and white leather [[cuffs]], [[stuffed wolf]] toy near her hip, and a rose [[tattoo]] on her right hip.

Her [[rigging]] has a single twin [[ship turret|turret]] on her right, a quad [[torpedo tubes|torpedo tube]] on her right, and a [[smokestack]] on her back. These are all in solid black and white paint-scheme.

title: vestal_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the repair ship USS [i]Vestal[/i] (AR-4) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Character designed by [[Saru]], voiced by Maia.

She is portrayed with [[blue eyes]] and [[light purple hair]], a small [[single braid]] on her left side, and [[bangs]]. She wears a modified [[nun]] outfit with a [[nurse cap]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[garter straps]]. She has several cloth, white crosses attached to her outfit, notably under her long [[overskirt]]. Her sleeves are split along the front, leading up to [[puffy short sleeves]]. Her robes, sleeves, and hat each have pink lining on the inside. Vestal also wears [[rei_no_himo|"that ribbon"]], tidying up her sleeves and supporting her breasts.

title: time_squad
body: Time Squad is an American animated television series created by Dave Wasson for [[Cartoon Network]] and the tenth of the network's Cartoon Cartoons. It follows the adventures of [[Otto Osworth]], [[Buck Tuddrussel]], and the robot [[Larry 3000]], a trio of hapless "time cops" living in the far distant future who travel back in time attempting to correct the course of history. During their adventures, they run into major historical figures such as [[Julius Caesar]], [[Abraham Lincoln]], [[Sigmund Freud]], [[Leonardo da Vinci]], the Founding Fathers, and [[Moctezuma]], who have taken a drastically different course of life than history dictates. The mission of the Time Squad is to guide these figures onto the correct path and ensure the integrity of the future.

title: tower_records
body: Tower Records was a former international retail store franchise that started in the US that sold music records, CDs and collectibles. Since 2006, Tower Records is no longer active due to bankruptcy with many of their US and international stores sold off or closed down. However, the brand is still active in Japan since Tower Records Japan went independent from the international brand in 2002 due to a management buyout and thus wasn't affected when the main Tower Records franchise went bankrupt.

title: kyotoben
body: A sub-dialect of [[Kansaiben]] spoken in [[Kyoto]]. h5. Noted speakers * [[Hanayagi Kaoruko]] ([[Shoujo Kageki Revue Starlight]]) * [[Ichimaru Gin]] ([[Bleach]]) * [[Kagenui Yozuru]] ([[Monogatari (series)|]]) * [[Kobayakawa Sae]] ([[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]) * [[Konoe Konoka]] ([[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]) * [[Lucky Lilac (Umamusume)|]] ([[Umamusume]]) * [[Shiver (Splatoon)|]] ([[Splatoon (series)|]]) * [[Tenkawa Kaoruko]]/[[Magia Sulfur]] ([[Mahou Shoujo ni Akogarete]]) h5. Salient features * Verb conjugations ending in はる haru * The copula どす dosu (standard Japanese です desu) * Unique negative conjugations of the verbs 来る kuru "to come" and する suru "to do": ** Kuru: きいひん kiihin (Osakaben けえへん keehen, standard Japanese こない konai) ** Suru: しいひん shiihin (Osakaben せえへん seehen, standard Japanese しない shinai) * The greetings おこしやす okoshiyasu and おいでやす oideyasu (standard Japanese いらっしゃいませ irasshaimase) h4. External references * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansai_dialect#Kyoto * https://japanese.stackexchange.com/questions/367/

title: chanchanko_(clothes)
body:
A type of traditional Japanese vest that is worn over other clothing.

It is often mixed up with other stuffed garments like the [[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]], dotera or tanzen, but is easily told apart because it has no sleeves.
It was mostly used as clothing for kids, but there is a custom for people who are celebrating reaching 60 years of age to wear a red chanchanko. This custom has become less popular in recent times.

Some well-known characters who wear chanchanko are:

* [[Kitarou]] from [[Gegege no Kitarou]]
* [[kitasan_black_(umamusume)|Kitasan Black]] from [[Umamusume]]
* [[Mito Mitsukuni]] from [[Mito Koumon]]

They also appear in a Japanese [[urban legend]] called the "Red chanchanko", a variant of "”Red Paper or Blue Paper”":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aka_Manto#The_legend].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: teletoon
body: Cartoon Network (formerly Teletoon) is a Canadian English-language discretionary specialty channel owned by Corus Entertainment. The channel primarily broadcasts animated series aimed at children and teenagers. It was launched on October 17, 1997, by Teletoon Canada, Inc., a consortium of Western International Communications and Astral Media (via their specialty channel Family Channel), Shaw Communications (via its specialty channel YTV), and the animation studios Cinar and Nelvana. With subsequent acquisitions and divestments, Corus became the sole owner of the channel in 2014. The channel has historically aired a mix of domestic productions and imported series, with many of the latter coming from U.S. channel Cartoon Network. In 2012, Teletoon launched a Canadian version of Cartoon Network as a sister network under license from Turner Broadcasting. In February 2023, Corus announced that Teletoon would rebrand as Cartoon Network on March 27, 2023, with the previous Cartoon Network channel concurrently relaunching under Cartoon Network's own sister brand Boomerang. Cartoon Network operates two timeshift feeds running on Eastern and Pacific schedules. Along with its French-language counterpart Télétoon, it is available in over 7.3 million households in Canada as of November 2013.

A 13-episode anime series produced by [i]Studio Deen[/i] aired between October and December 2003. If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own chin]].

title: hololive_grand_theft_auto
body:
A massive [[Hololive]] roleplaying event organized by [[Sakura Miko]] and [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], using [[Grand Theft Auto V]] + "FiveM":[https://fivem.net/] as its backdrop.  It ran for one week starting September 16, 2024, and involved almost everyone from all established Hololive branches.  Each member was given a "role", but aside from that emergent storytelling was allowed to unfold.  As a result, it has spawned many MANY memorable moments and setpieces, as shown in the art posted.

h4. Cast
h5. Ho-Los Santos Police Department
[b]Chief[/b]: [[Oozora Subaru]]
[b]Deputy Chief[/b]: [[Shishiro Botan]]
h6. Members
[[Sakura Miko]],  [[Mori Calliope]], [[Natsuiro Matsuri]], [[Tsunomaki Watame]], [[Kazama Iroha]], [[Koseki Bijou]], [[Nerissa Ravencroft]], [[Otonose Kanade]], [[Kureiji Ollie]], [[Vestia Zeta]], [[La+ Darknesss]], [[Shirogane Noel]]
h5. Ho-Los Santos Medical Department
[b]Director[/b]: [[Shirakami Fubuki]]
h6. Members
[[Ninomae Ina'nis]], [[Irys (Hololive)|IRyS]], [[Fuwawa Abyssgard|Fuwawa]] & [[Mococo Abyssgard]] (roleplaying as one person), [[Todoroki Hajime]], [[Ichijou Ririka]], [[Himemori Luna]], [[Airani Iofifteen]]
h5. Million Monster (Gang)
[b]Boss[/b]: [[Tokoyami Towa]]
[b]Underboss[/b]: [[Aki Rosenthal]]
h6. Members
[[Anya Melfissa]], [[Hakos Baelz]], [[Hakui Koyori]], [[Nakiri Ayame]], [[Nanashi Mumei]], [[Usada Pekora]], [[Akai Haato]]
h5. Others
* [b]Nyan Nyan Car Service[/b] (mechanics): [[Nekomata Okayu]] (Boss), [[Roboco-san]], [[Ouro Kronii]], [[Hiodoshi Ao]]
* [b]Cabaret Panpan Kamen[/b]: [[Houshou Marine]], [[Yukihana Lamy]], [[AZKi (Hololive)|]] (later), [[Tokino Sora]] (second job)
* [b]Korone's Bakery[/b]: [[Inugami Korone]] (Papa), [[Ookami Mio]] (Mama), [[Amane Kanata]] (daughter)
* [b]Pavonova Restaurant[/b]: [[Pavolia Reine]], [[Moona Hoshinova]]
* [b]Takamaru Transportation[/b]: [[Takane Lui]]
* [b]No Just-ice Iced Cream[/b]: [[Cecilia Immergreen]], [[Raora Panthera]], [[Gigi Murin]]
* [b]Pol News[/b]: [[Omaru Polka]]
* [b]Cat cafe[/b]: [[Tokino Sora]]
* [b]Independent[/b]: [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], [[Juufuutei Raden]], [[Watson Amelia]]

title: outstretched_leg

[[Outstretched leg]] signifies a pose with a leg fully extended, showcasing straight-line posture. 
If there are two legs fully extended, please refer to [[Outstretched legs]].

title: outstretched_legs
body:
[[Outstretched legs]] is a pose where both legs are fully extended, creating a straight-line form.
This tag is specifically used when both legs are straightened out. For a pose with a single leg extended, see [[Outstretched leg]].

title: jane_doe_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
A [[Mouse Girl|Rat Thiren]] and playable character in [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. First appearing in the "Undercover R&B" story, she is introduced as a high ranking member of the Mountain Lions, a criminal gang that have escaped capture from the New Eridu Public Security police force many times. [spoiler]In reality, Jane is a Criminal Psychologist working as an Undercover Informant  for NEPS to help them locate the Mountain Lions secret headquarters. While not officially part of NEPS, ingame she is considered a member of [[Zhu Yuan]]'s Criminal Investigation Special Response Team.[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Shimamura Yuu]] in Japanese and Kelsey Jaffer in English.

h4. Official art

* !post #8103309

title: rindou_mikoto
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Designed by [[ni02 (asahi nini)|Asahi Nini]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with a [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streak]] in the front, [[purple eyes]], [[pointy ears]], a [[skin fang]] and [[skin-covered horns]]] with a [[purple horns|purple]] [[gradient horns|horns]]. She also has a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]] and on [[mole on thigh|her right thigh]] and has [[thick eyebrows]] shaved into [[hikimayu]].

Her default hairstyle is [[short hair with long locks]] with [[crossed bangs]] [[hair between eyes|reaching between her eyes]], [[sidelocks]] held with black [[hair tubes]], and a large [[crescent hair ornament]] with [[hairpin]]s and a [[purple_ribbon|purple]] [[hair_ribbon|ribbon]].

title: inaba_mob_(touhou)
body:
Unnamed rabbit(s) OR humanoid rabbit youkai(s) who work and live in the [[Eientei]] household, so named because [[Houraisan Kaguya|Kaguya]] calls all Eientei rabbits by this name. They make their first clear appearance in [[Touhou Bougetsushou]], in both [[Silent Sinner in Blue]] and [[Inaba of the Moon and Inaba of the Earth]]. In the former, they are depicted in humanoid form, similar to Tewi. In the latter meanwhile, they are depicted in animal form, [[rabbit|bunnies]], with simple features such as ears and arms that are drawn round and short, simple slits for the eyes (although a more round one are also acceptable), and a cat-like curled mouth. 

* !post #629374: rabbit version
* !post #1815524: humanoid version

title: bob_odenkirk
body: Robert John Odenkirk (/ˈoʊdənkɜːrk/; born October 22, 1962) is an American actor, comedian, screenwriter, and producer. As an actor, he is known for his role as [[Saul Goodman]]/Jimmy McGill on [[Breaking Bad]] (2009–2013) and its spin-off [[Better Call Saul]] (2015–2022).

title: saul_goodman
body:
[b]James Morgan "Jimmy" McGill[/b], better known by his professional alias and business moniker [b]Saul Goodman[/b], is a criminal defense lawyer and con artist from the critically-acclaimed American television series [[Breaking Bad]] and the titular main protagonist of the prequel [[Better Call Saul]].

He is portrayed by [[Bob Odenkirk]].

title: jimmy_neutron
body: James Isaac "Jimmy" Neutron, commonly known as Jimmy Neutron, Boy Genius, is the protagonist and title character from the 2001 animated film Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius and its Nickelodeon television series adaptation The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron, Boy Genius. Created by showrunner John A. Davis, he has been voiced by Debi Derryberry since the test pilot premiered in 1998.

title: animal_collar
body:
A [[collar]] worn by a person (or animal), but specifically after or as a pet collar, typically a dog collar. It's usually a [[belt collar]], often with a [[buckle]]. The shape is usually on the thicker side and often sits looser around the neck, sometimes with a [[leash]], [[name tag]], [[neck bell]] or other animal-themed [[pendant]] attached, like a [[paw print]]. Most animal collars can also be tagged with another type of [[collar]], but add-ons like these, or the context give reason to add animal collar as well. 

Often worn by characters with [[animal ears]]. Sometimes associated with [[BDSM]] or [[pet play]].

H4. Examples
* !post #6602001: animal collar + [[neck bell]]  
* !post #6073365: with a [[leash]]
* !post #2394286: on an animal 



h4. See also

* [[belt collar]]
* [[neck bell]]
* [[spiked collar]]
* [[Tag group:Neck and neckwear]]

title: rocket_power
body: Rocket Power is an American animated television series created by Arlene Klasky and Gábor Csupó and produced by Klasky Csupo and Nickelodeon Animation Studio for [[Nickelodeon]]. The show centers on the daily lives of Otto, Reggie, Twister and Sam, four pre-adolescent children with an interest in extreme sports such as skateboarding and surfing while also getting into various situations.

title: whatever_happened_to..._robot_jones?
body: Whatever Happened to... Robot Jones? (simply known as Robot Jones or WHTRJ?) is an American animated television series created by Greg Miller for [[Cartoon Network]]. It follows Robot Jones, a teenage robot who attends the fictional suburban Polyneux Middle School in a retrofuturistic version of the 1980s. Episodes follow Robot Jones researching aspects of human life, including music, facial hair, and gym class. Jones is guided by his three friends, Socks, Mitch, and Cubey. Robot Jones is often smitten with his crush, [[Shannon Westerburg]], a tall, young girl with orthodontic headgear and a prosthesis. In school, Robot Jones interacts with his teachers, Mr. McMcMc, Mr. Workout, and Mrs. Raincoat; the principal, Mr. Madman; and janitor Clancy Q. Sleepyjeans. His arch-rivals, Lenny and Denny Yogman, try to sabotage Jones's research by making school more difficult for him.

title: my_gym_partner's_a_monkey
body: My Gym Partner's a Monkey is an American animated television series created by Tim Cahill and Julie McNally Cahill for [[Cartoon Network]]. It aired from December 26, 2005, to November 27, 2008, ending with a total of four seasons and 56 episodes. The series follows Adam Lyon, a human who, after a clerical error listed his surname as "Lion", is forced to transfer to Charles Darwin Middle School, a school for local anthropomorphic zoo animals, where he is partnered with Jake Spidermonkey in gym, and quickly becomes best friends with him.

title: chiaki_(yuki_hotaru)
body: An [[original]] character by [[yuki hotaru]].

title: cow_&_chicken
body: Cow and Chicken is an American animated comedy television series created by David Feiss for [[Cartoon Network]]. It is the third of the network's Cartoon Cartoons. It follows the surreal adventures of two talking animal siblings, Cow and Chicken. They are often antagonized by the Red Guy, a cartoonish version of the Devil who poses as various characters to scam them.

title: clarence
body: Clarence is an American animated television series created by Skyler Page for [[Cartoon Network]]. The series revolves around the title character and his two best friends, Jeff and Sumo.

title: the_life_&_times_of_juniper_lee
body: The Life and Times of Juniper Lee is an American animated television series created by former MTV reality star Judd Winick for [[Cartoon Network]] and produced by Cartoon Network Studios. It premiered May 30, 2005 on Cartoon Network and ended its run on April 9, 2007.

title: eustace_bagge
body: Eustace⁥ Bagge is the anti-heroic tritagonist of the series [[Courage the Cowardly Dog]]. He is a farmer who lives in the middle of Nowhere, Kansas with his wife Muriel Bagge and her dog Courage. He is usually antagonistic to Courage, but has frequently had to ally with or be rescued by Courage, occasionally showing him respect as a result.

title: courage_the_cowardly_dog
body: Courage the Cowardly Dog is an American animated comedy horror television series created by John R. Dilworth for [[Cartoon Network]]. It was produced by Dilworth's animation studio, Stretch Films. The eponymous character is an anxious [[dog]] who lives with an elderly couple, Muriel and [[Eustace Bagge]], in a farmhouse in the middle of Nowhere, a fictional town in Kansas. In each episode, the Bagges are repeatedly thrown into bizarre, frequently disturbing, and often paranormal or supernatural adventures, with Courage often having to rescue his owners. The series is known for its dark, surreal humor and atmosphere.

body: A country in the south of the [[Africa]] continent. Its population is a mixture of Bantu and white people (descendants of British and Dutch (Boer) colonists).

title: el_tigre
body: El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera (sometimes shortened to El Tigre) is a Mexican-American animated television series created by Jorge R. Gutierrez and Sandra Equihua that premiered on [[Nickelodeon]] on February 19, 2007. The series centers on a 13-year-old boy named Manny Rivera, better known as "El Tigre". He is trying his best to choose between being good or evil while dealing with bizarre enemies, aiming to gain his belt's buckle to become a tiger-themed superhero. There are two paths Manny must choose between in the show, either to become the son of a legendary hero known as "[[rodolfo rivera (el tigre)|White Pantera]]" and the grandson of an evil super villain known as "Puma Loco". The show is set in Miracle City, a fictional city based on and located at Tijuana, where Jorge grew up. The series was produced by Nickelodeon Animation Studio and was animated using Adobe Flash. A total of 26 episodes were produced before it was cancelled.

title: senpai_ga_uzai_kouhai_no_hanashi
body:
[b]Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi[/b] (先輩がうざい後輩の話, lit. [i]Story of a Kouhai Annoyed by Her Senpai[/i]) is a slice-of-life office comedy webcomic by [[Shiromanta]].

Initially serialized as webcomic in 2017 (pool #12918), Ichijinsha began publishing the work in print in 2018. Seven Seas Entertainment has licensed the English version and is publishing it under the title "My Senpai is Annoying". It received an anime adaptation in Fall 2021.

Series concluded in July 2024.

title: kneehighs
body:
[[Socks]] that are knee-height, or just below knee-height.

Despite the name, kneehighs are usually slightly shorter than knee-height, usually ending a few inches below the knee, or at around 3/4 calf height.

If they're completely below shin-height, they're [[ankle socks]].

See [[over-kneehighs]] for thighhighs that reach just above the knee. See [[knee boots]] for knee-length boots.

body:
Novelty [[socks]] that are knitted so that each toe is individually encased the same way that fingers are individually encased in a [[gloves|glove]]. Tag can also be used loosely with images of toes being individually seen within the sock.

Although not a novelty, the traditional Japanese footwear called [[tabi]], gives a similar impression. However, do not tag tabi as toe_socks.

title: synduality_noir
body:
The anime of [[Bandai Namco]]'s [[science fiction]] project, [[Synduality]]. It's co-produced by Eight Bit and Bandai Namco Filmworks.

The Anime takes place in 2242, 20 years after the [[synduality echo of ada|game]]. It mainly talks about the relationships between human and their [[android]] partner, [[Magus (synduality)|]].

Character draft by [[neco]], [[mecha]] designer is [[Gyoubu Ippei]], character designer & animation director is [[Katsura Ken'ichirou]].

The anime has a spin-off in the form of [[Synduality Ellie]].

h4. External links

* "Anime Official Website":[https://synduality-noir.com]

title: android
body:
A [[robot]] that looks human, or very nearly human, with a fully human face.

They may appear male, female, or [[androgynous]]. Female androids, also known as gynoids, are the most common in anime. Androids often have small robotic appendages or markings to make it apparent they are not human. The most common of these are [[robot ears]], [[robot joints]], [[mechanical wings]], and attached [[cable]]s.

The difference between a [[humanoid robot]] and an [[android]] is that an android looks mostly human, usually having something resembling skin (though it needn't be skin-colored) and a fully human face, while a humanoid robot is clearly non-human, with a non-human face.

This tag should not be used if the character looks completely human, with no visible robotic traits. Tag what you see, not what you know.

Not to be confused with [[cyborg]], which is a person augmented with mechanical body parts.

h4. Examples

* !post #7999269

title: yuki_miku_(2022)
body:

The 2022 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was 海 (sea/ocean).

The winning entry was drawn by [[hamudetsu]] and features a naval captain [[sailor]] costume with a crab motif. She has [[heart-shaped pupils]] (or [[heart in eye]]) and wears a [[peaked cap]], red [[hair ribbon]] that resemble crab claws, and black [[fur-trimmed coat]] over a white [[double-breasted]] jacket over a [[red shirt]] with [[black necktie]]. She also wears black [[short shorts]] with red and white [[striped thighhighs]].

Her fan nicknames include Kani-chan (Crab-chan), Senchou-chan (Captain-chan), or Kani senchou-chan.

Her theme song is [[Kimiiro Marine Snow_(vocaloid)|]] by Carlos Hakamada.

title: yuezheng_ling

Created for the [[Vsinger (vocaloid)|]] project (formerly VOCALOID China Project), she is formerly known as Ling Caiyin (绫 彩音), an original Vocaloid character illustrated by [[Rikuhao]].

Her finalized appearance was illustrated by [[ideolo]]. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[ahoge]] and a [[single braid]]. She wears a [[red dress]] over [[bike shorts]], [[see-through necktie|see-through]] [[necktie]] with a [[choker]], a [[single thighhigh]] and [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]], and [[boots]].

She's popularly paired with Luo Tianyi, another Vocaloid and fellow Vsinger. Their duo is called "南北组/南北組 (Nanbei zu).":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E5%8D%97%E5%8C%97%E7%B5%84

title: kankaku_shadan
body:
[b]Kankaku shaden[/b] (lit. "[[Sensory deprivation]]" or "Sense blocking pit") is a fetish consisting of a character falling into a [[tentacle pit]] and being [[tentacle sex|ravaged by tentacles]], while being [[unaware]] of what's happening to them due to having their senses cut off, usually by either magic or paralyzing poison.

Often includes a follow up where the sensory nulling ends for one reason or another, which causes the victim to be forced to feel intense senses of overwhelming pleasure all at once. [[Breast expansion]] and [[inflation]] are often present as well.

The fetish originates from post #6364507 by [[Shirabe Shiki]], which also gives the fetish its name.

In rare cases when a [[tentacle pit]] is not involved but the setting is otherwise similar, the tag is still applicable.

h4. See also

title: shin_megami_tensei_iii:_nocturne
body:
Shn Megami Tensei: Nocturne (真・女神転生III-NOCTURNE, lit. "True Goddess Reincarnation III-NOCTURNE) is the third game in the [[Shin Megami Tensei]] series. Know as "Shin Megami Tensei: Lucifer's Call" in PAL regions.

In the story, the world comes to an end during an event called the "Conception", whose purpose is to destroy the old world in order to create a new one. The few survivors each possess a 'Reason', an idea of how the new world should be like. The main character, the [[Demi-Fiend]], must then choose which Reason he will support, achieving different endings for the story depending on which one is chosen.

A Director's Cut version of the game was released, named "Shin Megami Tensei: Nocturne Maniax", and featured an additional dungeon, bosses and [[dante_(devil_may_cry)|Dante]] from the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series as a recruitable character. It was this version that was localized into english and released outside of Japan.

Another version of the game, called "Shin Megami Tensei: Nocturne Chronicles" was released alongside a limited edition of [[Devil Summoner (series)|]]: Raidou Kuzunoha vs. King Abbadon, where [[Kuzunoha Raidou]] replaced Dante as the special recruitable character.

h4. Characters

* [[Demi-Fiend]]
* [[Nitta Isamu]]
* [[Tachibana Chiaki (megami Tensei)|]]
* [[Takao Yuko]]

title: horizontally_flipped
body:
When an image is horizontally reversed from what it 'should' be based on asymmetrical details of a character's design, such as reversed [[heterochromia]] or being depicted as left-handed when they are right-handed in all other images.

This tag is not for all cases of [[artistic_error|reversed heterochromia]], though, rather more strongly-evident cases where the following is likely to have happened: Artists often flip their work periodically while drawing to make sure it looks right from both perspectives and the angles of the lineart are not slanted, and such images may be a result of them forgetting to set it to the correct orientation before publishing.

This is arguably distinct from [[artistic error]]s since it is not details [i]within[/i] the image that are incorrect, only the formatting of the image itself.

title: honoka_(doa)
body:
A high school student and martial artist who made her debut in the 2015 title [[Dead or Alive 5]].

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] to [[medium hair|medium length]] [[pink hair]] stylized with a [[one side up]] & [[bangs]]. Usually wears a [[skull hair ornament]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blazer]], [[red necktie]], [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]], [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. She has the [[large breasts|largest breast size]] out of all DOA characters, not counting [[Nicole 458]].

Honoka bears a strong resemblance to [[Kosaka Honoka]] from the anime television series, [[Love Live!]]

In December 2020, she received the skin [[Honoka (Summer Angel on the Shore) (DoA)|]] as part of a collab with [[Azur Lane]].

title: chikuma_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Chikuma[/i]. Character design by [[Shisantian]]. 

She had been present in the game since the beginning, but would be formally introduced following a [[Chikuma (old design) (azur lane)|complete redesign of her character]] in the [i]Upon the Shimmering Blue[/i] event. 

She now has a similar appearance to [[Atago (Azur Lane)|]], with the primary difference being her outfit (now featuring an updated [[black skirt]] and white top, with the [[detached sleeves]] now joined to the rest of the dress), her thighhighs changed from to [[black thighhighs|black]], [[long hair]] instead of short while still retaining her [[brown hair|hair color]], and the fact that she has [[rabbit ears]], which has led to comparisons with [[Arknights]]' [[amiya (arknights)|Amiya]] and subsequent donkey jokes.

Her rig was also given an update, now sporting four 20.3 cm twin mounts (one to her left, one on her back raised to the front, two on her right), triple [[torpedo tubes]], a seaplane, and a place to hold her [[ootachi]] on her left rig.

title: janus_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] J-class destroyer HMS [i]Janus[/i] (F53). Character design by [[Mimoza (96mimo414)|]], voiced by [[Kino Hina]]. 

She is named after "Janus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janus], a Roman deity.

In-game, she has [[long hair|long]] [[light blue hair]] tied in [[braid|braided]] [[low twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[medium breasts|modestly-sized chest]].

Her outfit consists of a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[white dress]] with a [[red ribbon]] holding the dress in place, [[detached sleeves]] exposing her [[bare shoulders]], [[white thighhighs]] with additional red ribbons acting as [[thigh strap|thigh straps]], and a white [[collar]]. She also holds a [[staff]] much like her older sister [i][[Jervis (Azur Lane)|]][/i].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 120 mm twin gun mount QF Mk7 and her bridge (and associated fire control director) to her right, 53.3 cm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]] and a funnel to her left, held together by a hull piece to her back that contains her [[depth charge]] roller racks.

title: jervis_(azur_lane)
body:
HMS [i]Jervis[/i], pennant number F00 from 1938 to 1940 and G00 during World War II, as depicted in the game [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[NG Jie]].

In-game, she is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] that has a dark outer shade and lighter fringes [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]], twin [[cone hair bun|cone hair buns]], and [[purple eyes]]; somewhat a shipgirl version of [[Rice Shower (Umamusume)|]] with an additional [[nurse cap]] and a [[medium breasts|significant chest size]].

Her outfit consists of a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[white dress]] with black inner layer and [[cleavage cutout]], [[feathered wings]] [[low wings|attached low to her waistline]], a [[white pantyhose]], black [[ankle strap|ankle straps]], [[high heels]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], black [[armlet|armlets]], and a large [[black ribbon]] to her back.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single ornate [[staff]] that she rides, holds her 120 mm twin gun mount and two 53.3 cm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]]. She also wields a separate staff with [[blood bag]]s attached to it. To her back, she has a [[eye mask|masked]] lady in white as a [[familiar]], surrounded by [[pigeon|pigeons]] in flight.
